0.title: Biker misbehaves with women cyclists in Bengaluru; manhunt launched
0.article_body: The police said on Monday that a manhunt has been launched for a biker who has been misbehaving with women cyclists in Bengaluru. The women cyclists, who have filed separate complaints, have not been able to identify the biker or note the bike's registration number. According to the police, the biker is believed to be a food delivery boy.

1.title: Pretty sure we'll be able to have dinner together: Bairstow on his spat with Kohli
1.article_body: Referring to his spat with Virat Kohli during Day 3 of the fifth Test, Jonny Bairstow said, "There was nothing." He added, "We've been fortunate to play against each other for ten years. So...I’m pretty sure we’ll be able to have dinner [together]." Bairstow stated, "We're playing Test cricket and we're two competitors. It brings the best out of us."

2.title: Pant breaks Dhoni's record, scores most runs in a Test in England by an India keeper
2.article_body: Rishabh Pant has set the record for scoring most runs in a Test in England by an India wicketkeeper. The 24-year-old scored 203 runs (146 in the first innings and 57 in the second innings) in the rescheduled fifth Test at Edgbaston to create the record. The previous record of 151 runs was set by MS Dhoni in 2011.

3.title: Data of 1 bn Chinese citizens allegedly stolen, hacker offers to sell it for ₹1.58 cr
3.article_body: A hacker has claimed to have stolen one billion Chinese citizens' data after breaching a Shanghai police database, in what's being called one of the biggest data breaches ever. The hacker has offered to sell over 23 TB of data for 10 Bitcoin worth about ₹1.58 crore. It includes names, addresses, birthplaces, national IDs, phone numbers and criminal case information.

4.title: Pic of PM Modi touching feet of freedom fighter's daughter released
4.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday met the family of Pasala Krishna Murthy, who was a freedom fighter from Andhra Pradesh. The government shared a picture of PM Modi touching the feet of the freedom fighter's daughter Pasala Krishna Bharathi. "She's 90 years old and she blessed the PM, [he] also met her sister and niece," the government said.

5.title: Actor Vishal suffers leg injury during 'Laththi' shoot months after hand injury
5.article_body: Actor Vishal suffered an injury on his leg while filming the climax of his upcoming Tamil film 'Laththi'. This is the second time that Vishal has suffered an injury on the sets of the film. In February, Vishal suffered multiple hairline fractures on his hand and finger while shooting an action sequence for the film.

6.title: He nullified drive, scored 241: Vaughan wants Zak to go Tendulkar way
6.article_body: Former England skipper Michael Vaughan has said that English opener Zak Crawley should do what former India batter Sachin Tendulkar did to tackle seam bowling. "Tendulkar had a tough tour to Australia in 2004...he was getting out playing the drive. What did he do? He nullified the drive...scored 241 in Sydney. Crawley has not tried that yet," Vaughan said.

7.title: Who benefitted from Kanhaiya Lal’s murder? BJP: Mehbooba Mufti
7.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti said BJP provides support and patronage to criminal elements and uses them for their benefit and propaganda. "When Kanhaiya Lal was murdered (in Udaipur), Hindus and Muslims went against each other. Who benefitted? BJP," Mufti added. "Questions are raised on Pulwama attack…How did the attack take place? Who benefitted from it? BJP," she stated.

8.title: Woman ends life by jumping in front of Jor Bagh metro, service disrupted
8.article_body: A woman died by suicide by jumping in front of a moving train at Delhi metro's Jor Bagh metro station, according to the police. The incident caused a temporary disruption of service on a part of the Yellow Line corridor. There was no suicide note found on her, because of which the reason behind the extreme step remains unknown.

9.title: 4-year-old girl raped in Delhi, neighbour held
9.article_body: A man was held by the Delhi Police for allegedly raping a four-year-old girl in North East Delhi. Police received information about the incident on Sunday night and alleged that the accused misbehaved with the girl after he saw her alone. Both families live in the same building and are involved in labour work, police said.

10.title: NCP's Ajit Pawar to be Leader of Opposition in Maharashtra Assembly
10.article_body: Former Maharashtra Deputy CM and NCP leader Ajit Pawar will be the new Leader of Opposition in the state Assembly. As per reports, the decision was proposed by NCP Legislative party leader Jayant Patil and approved by the Assembly. Earlier on Monday, CM Eknath Shinde-led Maharashtra government passed the floor test after surpassing the majority mark of 144.

11.title: Sehwag criticised for his 'Chamiya naach rahi hai' remark on Kohli's celebratory dance
11.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has been criticised over his 'Chamiya naach rahi hai' remark on Virat Kohli's celebratory dance during the third day of the rescheduled India-England fifth Test at Edgbaston. "Disgraceful! Inappropriate for game of cricket," a fan commented. "Sehwag used a slur that's offensive," another wrote. Another tweet read, "Sehwag is absolutely horrendous when commentating."

12.title: Ranveer to replace Karan Johar as 'Bigg Boss OTT 2' host: Reports
12.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh will replace filmmaker Karan Johar as the host of the upcoming season of 'Bigg Boss OTT', according to reports. "Makers have started working on the second season of Bigg Boss OTT. As they couldn't get dates from Karan Johar, the makers have finalised Ranveer Singh to host the show," reports stated.

13.title: Sushmita starrer Aarya to return with season 3: Director Ram Madhvani
13.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen's show 'Aarya' is all set to return with season 3. Director Ram Madhvani took to social media to share the update. Alongside the post, he wrote, "Aarya Season 3 in Development. Creator @madhvaniram, @sushmitasen47, @disneyplushotstar and @endemolshineind collaborate once again to escalate the excitement." The post has a video clip capturing the high points of season 2.

14.title: Had tears as it was my dream to score a Ranji ton for Mumbai: Sarfaraz
14.article_body: Mumbai batter Sarfaraz Khan revealed that he had "tears" in his eyes when he was leaving Mumbai to play for Uttar Pradesh in 2015/16. "I had tears in my eyes as it was my dream to score a Ranji Trophy hundred in Mumbai clothes," Sarfaraz said. Notably, the 24-year-old cricketer made a comeback to the Mumbai side in 2019/20.

15.title: Reports stating Cong likely to pull out of MVA alliance are false: HK Patil
15.article_body: Following the political development in state, Maharashtra Congress in-charge HK Patil on Monday said the MVA alliance is stable. “I saw some reports stating Congress is likely to pull out of the MVA alliance in Maharashtra. They are false,” Patil added. “Congress has neither discussed this nor decided on anything. The rumours are far away from the truth,” he stated.

16.title: Declared 'persona non grata', Russian diplomats leave Bulgaria
16.article_body: Many Russian diplomats, along with their families, left Bulgaria in two airplanes on Sunday after they were declared "persona non grata". Before leaving, a diplomat said he was among the 70 Russian staff, who were ordered to leave the country. The mass expulsion decision was announced by Bulgaria's acting Prime Minister Kiril Petkov.

17.title: Will provide free electricity upto 300 units in Gujarat if elected: Kejriwal
17.article_body: AAP National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal said that his party will make electricity free upto 300 units in Gujarat just like it did in Punjab, if voted to power. "In Gujarat, ministers are enjoying because their electricity bill comes to zero despite consuming thousands of units but a poor has to pay thousands for just a fan and bulb," he said.

18.title: Bharat Gogawale gives petition to suspend 16 MLAs of Uddhav Thackeray faction
18.article_body: The chief whip of Shiv Sena's Eknath Shinde faction, Bharat Gogawale, has given a petition to Maharashtra Assembly Speaker for suspension of 16 MLAs of the Uddhav Thackeray faction. News agency ANI said the Speaker's office has confirmed that the notice will be issued to 16 MLAs of Shiv Sena for the violation of whip.

19.title: UP can lead country ahead: CM Yogi on completing 100 days of 2nd term
19.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday said that his government has worked to change UP’s image of "hooliganism and crime", with foreign investment subsequently rising. "UP is the biggest state in the country and can lead the country ahead," CM Yogi added. His statement came on the completion of 100 days of his government's second term.

20.title: Teacher caught on camera slapping, beating 5-yr-old with stick in Bihar; boy faints
20.article_body: A video of a Patna tuition teacher slapping and beating a five-year-old boy with a stick is being widely circulated online. The teacher could be seen using a stick to beat the kid until it breaks, with reports claiming that the boy lost consciousness after the beating. IAS officer Awanish Sharan said an FIR has been filed against the teacher.

21.title: Tiger and I both have a soft corner for each other: Kriti Sanon
21.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon spoke about reuniting with Tiger Shroff in 'Ganapath Part 1', saying that the two have a soft corner for each other. Kriti and Tiger made their debut together in the 2014 film 'Heropanti'. "We were like babies and we both have grown as people and also as actors...I think we have great chemistry," the actress added.

22.title: Punjab man 'sold' in search of job jailed in N Macedonia for 5 yrs
22.article_body: A man from Punjab's Nawanshahr is serving five-year jail term in North Macedonia after he was nabbed there without his passport. The man, Balvir Ram, who wanted to travel to Greece to seek employment, was allegedly "sold" by a travel agent to some Pakistani agents in Serbia. Those agents then allegedly trafficked Ram to North Macedonia and confiscated his passport.

23.title: Class 12 boy kills teacher in UP, wanted to get out of relationship with her; arrested
23.article_body: A student of class 12 was arrested by Uttar Pradesh Police in Ayodhya for allegedly murdering his teacher. "The arrested boy was in a relationship with the victim teacher. He wanted to get out of the relationship as he was scared of getting exposed," police said. "The teacher used to threaten him of making insulting revelations about him," police added.

24.title: I thank him for giving us such a film: Rajinikanth praises Madhavan's Rocketry
24.article_body: Veteran actor Rajinikanth has penned a note praising R Madhavan's film 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect'. He said that everyone should watch the film, especially the youngsters. "In his (Madhavan) very first film, he has proved that he is on par with other great filmmakers," Rajinikanth wrote, adding, "I thank him for giving us such a film. Congratulations."

25.title: PM secures future of friends abroad, leaves youth here jobless: Rahul
25.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday alleged that PM Narendra Modi secures futures of friends abroad, but leaves the youth of India unemployed. Rahul also shared a video of young men who had taken the exam for recruitment as police personnel in the Central paramilitary forces walking on the streets in protest because they never got the results.

26.title: B'luru citizens' group calls for bandh on July 12 over Eidgah ground issue
26.article_body: The Chamarajpet Citizens' Federation, which comprises several trader organisations and right-wing Hindu outfits, called for a bandh on July 12 in Bengaluru over the Eidgah ground ownership issue. The citizens' group stated that the ground is for the public and not a Wakf Board property. It had reportedly planned to launch a door-to-door campaign over the issue.

27.title: Anshula shares video writing 'No Bra Club', Priyanka comments 'Everyday'
27.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor's sister Anshula Kapoor shared a video on Instagram in which she removes her bra from under her dress, writing, "The best part about coming home from Sunday brunch! #NoBraClub." Actress Priyanka Chopra reacted to Anshula's post, commenting, "Everyday" with a laughing emoji. Another social media user commented, "During the pandemic every day was Sunday."

28.title: Taapsee Pannu to produce a film starring Samantha Ruth Prabhu
28.article_body: Taapsee Pannu is all set to produce a film starring Samantha Ruth Prabhu. "There's something that we're working together on. We will announce what it is very soon," Taapsee, who will next be seen in 'Shabaash Mithu', said. Taapsee is also producing a film titled, 'Dhak Dhak', which stars Ratna Pathak Shah, Fatima Sana Shaikh, Dia Mirza and Sanjana Sanghi.

29.title: Bairstow was batting carefully; got pumped after Kohli's sledge: Jaffer
29.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said that he feels that English batter Jonny Bairstow got "pumped" after being sledged by India's Virat Kohli at the Edgbaston Test on Sunday. "Yes...because before that [sledging] he [Bairstow] was batting very carefully. But when you instigate someone, it backfires sometimes. So maybe Bairstow got pumped up after that sledge," Jaffer said.

30.title: Her last post was for SSR, she wanted to talk about him: Saroj Khan's daughter
30.article_body: Saroj Khan's daughter Sukaina recalled the late choreographer told her to write a post for Sushant Singh Rajput after his death. "[Mom] enjoyed social media a lot. She used to...say, 'Even I'd like to post something,"' Sukaina said. "The last post...was for Sushant. She told me, 'Please write down a post, I want to talk about that boy,'" Sukaina added.

31.title: Australian PM visits Ukraine, pledges additional aid worth ₹540 cr
31.article_body: Australian PM Anthony Albanese has pledged additional military and technical aid worth about A$100 million (over ₹540 crore) following his visit to Kyiv. The package includes 14 armoured personnel carriers and 20 Bushmaster protected mobility vehicles, among others. Albanese also said that Australia will ban Russian gold imports and sanction 16 more of the latter country's ministers and oligarchs.

32.title: 4 arrested for killing 53-yr-old property dealer in Pune 11 months ago
32.article_body: Four men have been arrested for allegedly killing a 53-year-old property dealer in Pune district in August 2021. The victim was found strangled to death with her limbs tied and mouth taped at her house in Chikhali. The woman wore a lot of gold ornaments and the suspects targeted her to rob her of the valuables and cash, police said.

33.title: Delhi Assembly passes bills to hike salaries of its members by 66%
33.article_body: The Delhi Assembly on Monday passed bills proposing 66.67% hike in salaries and allowances of its members. "For Delhi MLAs, salary and allowances are being increased from ₹54,000 per month to ₹90,000," Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said. "To invite talented people into politics, there has to be rewards," he added. The bills will be sent to the President for approval.

34.title: Complaint filed against 'Kaali' director Leena for poster of goddess smoking cigarette
34.article_body: A police complaint has been filed against Leena Manimekalai, the director of the documentary 'Kaali', over a poster showing a woman dressed as the Hindu goddess smoking a cigarette. The complaint has been filed by a lawyer from Delhi. Calling the poster "highly objectionable", the lawyer sought a ban on the picture and relevant clip of the documentary.

35.title: Shinde faction cannot claim to be original Shiv Sena: Sanjay Raut
35.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut said that the faction led by Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde cannot claim to be original Shiv Sena. The "Thackeray name is synonymous with Shiv Sena," the Rajya Sabha member said. "They used the party symbol and all benefits that come along with it to win election, and then broke the same party," Raut further said.

36.title: Decisions taken in MVA govt's last cabinet meet will be upheld: Fadnavis
36.article_body: The newly-formed Maharashtra government, led by CM Eknath Shinde, will uphold the previous government's decision to rename Aurangabad and Osmanabad, as well as the upcoming Navi Mumbai International Airport, deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis announced on Monday. "We will take a cabinet meet and reaffirm the renaming of cities decided by the last cabinet meet of the previous government," he added.

37.title: A cricket-loving nation should love women's team equally: Taapsee
37.article_body: Taapsee Pannu, who'll play the role of former Indian women’s cricket team captain, Mithali Raj in the biopic 'Shabaash Mithu', said in our country there are two religions, cricket and films. "If you call yourself a cricket-loving nation then you should love women’s cricket equally, you're not just men’s cricket-loving nation," she said. "Cricket should matter and not...gender," Taapsee added.

38.title: Putin will not congratulate Biden on US Independence Day: Russia
38.article_body: Russia said that President Vladimir Putin will not congratulate his American counterpart Joe Biden on the US' Independence Day on July 4. "Congratulations this year can hardly be considered appropriate," said Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov. "The United States' unfriendly policies are the reason," he added. The statement comes amid tensions between the two countries owing to the Ukraine war.

39.title: Had once said that I'll come back, several people mocked me: Fadnavis
39.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Monday said, "I had once said that I'll come back but when I said that, several people mocked me." "I've come back today and brought him (Eknath Shinde) along with me. I won't take revenge on people who mocked me. I'll forgive them. Everything isn't taken to heart in politics,"  Fadnavis added.

40.title: Plant presumed extinct rediscovered after 188 years in Himachal Pradesh
40.article_body: A plant species, Brachystelma attenuatum, which scientists had presumed extinct has been rediscovered in Himachal Pradesh's Hamirpur and Mandi districts after 188 years. It was identified by researchers from Botanical Survey of India, Dehradun and Himachal Pradesh University, Shimla. Its last record dates back to 1835 when British botanists John Royle and Robert Wight found the plant in Himachal.

41.title: Kind of see a little bit of myself in his game: Djokovic on facing Sinner
41.article_body: Talking about facing his quarter-final opponent Jannik Sinner at Wimbledon, top seed Novak Djokovic said the 20-year-old Italian is very solid and is maturing a lot on the big stage. "I kind of see a little bit of myself in his game, as well, from back of the court, playing flat backhands, constantly staying on...back of the line," he added.

42.title: Hyd civic body levies fines on BJP & TRS for unauthorised banners
42.article_body: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has levied fines on TRS and BJP for hosting unauthorised banners, posters and signboards. GHMC reportedly fined BJP of approximately ₹20 lakh while it levied fine of up to ₹3 lakh on TRS, stating that the amount may increase if banners stay up. Political posters, including some inspired by 'Money Heist', surfaced across Hyderabad recently.

43.title: Shankar sings happy birthday to Ranveer at US concert, videos viral
43.article_body: Ranveer Singh and Deepika Padukone attended Shankar Mahadevan's concert in US' California where Shankar sang happy birthday to Ranveer. Ranveer will celebrate his 37th birthday on Wednesday. Videos from the concert have gone viral. One of them shows Ranveer onstage, saying, "I was given strict instructions to not do this...[My mother-in-law] is sitting in...front row wagging her finger at me."

44.title: Payments to Aakash are closed: BYJU'S amid reports of delay in $1 billion deal
44.article_body: India's most valuable edtech startup BYJU'S said that its payments to Aakash Educational Services are closed after reports emerged that it is pushing back payments. In 2021, BYJU'S struck a deal to acquire Aakash, which runs a chain of physical coaching centres, in a cash-and-stock deal worth $1 billion. "All payments are expected to be completed by...August," BYJU'S earlier said.

45.title: Padma Shri recipient director Tarun Majumdar passes away aged 91
45.article_body: Padma Shri recipient director Tarun Majumdar passed away aged 91 on Monday. He was on ventilator support and undergoing treatment for age-related ailments at the state-run hospital SSKM in Kolkata. He won the National Award four times for his films 'Kancher Swarga', 'Nimantran', 'Ganadevata' and 'Aranya Amar'. He also received five Filmfare Awards including the Lifetime Achievement Award in 2021.

46.title: 22 MLAs remained absent during Maharashtra floor test process
46.article_body: A total of 22 MLAs remained absent during the process of floor test in Maharashtra Assembly on Monday. The list of absent MLAs includes 10 Congress MLAs - Jitesh Antapurkar, Zeeshan Siddique, Praniti Shinde, Ashok Chavan, Vijay Wadettiwar, Dhiraj Deshmukh, Kunal Patil, Raju Awale, Mohanrao Hambarde and Shirish Chaudhari. Eknath Shinde won the floor test with 164-99 margin.

47.title: 7 get stuck in elevator of 7-storey Thane building, rescued after 30 mins
47.article_body: Seven people got stuck in an elevator of a seven-storey building in Thane on Monday, a civic official said. Local fire officials rushed to the spot after getting information, the official added. The firemen managed to open the lift and rescued the people, who were stuck in it for about half-an-hour.

48.title: Himachal CM visits Kullu where 12, including students, died in accident
48.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jairam Thakur visited the Kullu district where at least 12 people, including school children, were killed and dozen injured after a bus fell into a gorge on Monday. The private bus was on its way to Sainj from Kullu. The Chief Minister has announced ₹5 lakh for the family members of those killed in the accident.

49.title: Which are the best performing states in providing startup ecosystem as per Govt rankings?
49.article_body: The third edition of the State's Startup Ranking of 2021 was released on Monday. For the category of best performers in developing a startup ecosystem, Gujarat emerged as the best performer for the third consecutive year, along with Karnataka. Meghalaya has topped the list of small states. A total of 24 states and seven Union Territories participated in this.

50.title: 10,000 became unemployed; 200 died in Char Dham: Rawat on BJP govt's 100 days
50.article_body: Former Uttarakhand CM Harish Rawat has commented on the completion of 100 days of the BJP-run Uttarakhand government. "In the last 100 days, at least 10,000 youths have joined the list of the unemployed. Over 200 persons died during the Char Dham Yatra [this year]," Rawat said. The Congress leader added that the Centre's Agnipath scheme is a "fraud".

51.title: Judicial verdicts can't be reflection of influence of public opinion: SC judge
51.article_body: Supreme Court judge Justice JB Pardiwala said Judicial verdicts cannot be the reflection of the influence of public opinion. Justice Pardiwala along with Justice Surya Kant heard Nupur Sharma’s plea. "A judicial verdict, right or wrong, is always by a court vested with the powers under the Constitution of India as a court of record," Justice Pardiwala added.

52.title: 20-yr-old man killed with key after argument over vehicles touching in Delhi
52.article_body: A 20-year-old man was stabbed to death with a key after getting into an argument with another person over their vehicles touching on Delhi road. Reports said that the deceased and his friend were returning after purchasing liquor when person they had an argument with returned with his associate. The deceased was then struck in the chest with a key.

53.title: US study claims new COVID-19 test can detect all variants in hours
53.article_body: Researchers at a university in the US claimed to have developed a new COVID-19 test that can detect all current variants of SARS-CoV-2 accurately within hours. The test, called CoVarScan, can identify signatures of eight hotspots on the SARS-CoV-2 virus. The study, published in the Clinical Chemistry journal, was based on samples collected from over 4,000 patients.

54.title: Bumrah is that rare beast of international cricket, a fast-bowling captain: Lloyd
54.article_body:
Ex-England player David Lloyd has praised India's stand-in captain Jasprit Bumrah, stating that the 28-year-old belongs to "rare beasts of international cricket", the fast-bowling captains. Lloyd added, 
"Bumrah is high-quality and must be so awkward to face...the batsman doesn't get a clear view of the ball due to the quirkiness of his action...He takes his wickets at spit."

55.title: Gunman acted alone, no terror link: Police on Copenhagen shooting
55.article_body: The Danish Police on Monday said that the Copenhagen mall shooting, which left three people dead, was not related to terrorism. The police said the 22-year-old suspect acted alone and chose his victims at random. The police did not discuss the motive behind the killing but said, "Our suspect is also known among psychiatric services."

56.title: NCW seeks action against Akhilesh Yadav for his tweet against Nupur Sharma
56.article_body: National Commission for Women's Chairperson Rekha Sharma has written to Uttar Pradesh DGP to take immediate action against former CM Akhilesh Yadav for his tweet against suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma. After the Supreme Court said that Sharma should apologise for her remarks against Prophet Muhammad, Yadav tweeted, "Not only the face, but the body should also apologise."

57.title: 1st look of Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air's crew uniform with sneakers released
57.article_body: Billionaire and ace investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air has released the first look of its crew uniform comprising orange jackets, black trousers and sneakers. The airline said it's the first to introduce such a uniform for the in-flight crew. The uniforms are made using recycled polyester fabric made from pet bottle plastics salvaged from marine waste, said Akasa.

58.title: Late actor Sushant Singh Rajput's ex-flatmate Siddharth Pithani granted bail in drugs case
58.article_body: The Bombay High Court on Monday granted bail to late actor Sushant Singh Rajput's former flatmate Siddharth Pithani in a drugs case linked to Sushant's death. He was arrested by the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) from Hyderabad in May 2021. In the bail plea, his lawyer claimed that there was no evidence of Pithani's involvement in illicit drug trafficking.

59.title: India U-17 women's football team's assistant coach Ambrose sacked for sexual misconduct
59.article_body: India Under-17 women's football team's assistant coach Alex Ambrose has been sacked for alleged sexual misconduct, SY Quraishi, a member of the Supreme Court-appointed Committee of Administrators (CoA) overseeing the All India Football Federation (AIFF) said. The 39-year-old was earlier told to return to India midway through the team's preparation tour to Italy and Norway.

60.title: India needs fewer GST slabs, but 28% rate will remain: Revenue Secretary
60.article_body: Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj said the government aims to simplify the GST by consolidating the lower tax slabs. "India needs fewer slabs. 28% slab will remain, but whether 5%, 12%, and 18% rates can be simplified is yet to be seen," he explained. The government is aiming for stability in GST in the next one or two years, Bajaj added.

61.title: Didn't want to step out after 'Tees Maar...', mom-in-law encouraged me: Farah
61.article_body: Choreographer-director Farah Khan recalled how her film 'Tees Maar Khan' was "ripped apart" by people and said, "After Tees Maar Khan, I didn't want to step out, even though I was winning...award for...choreography of Sheila Ki Jawani." "My mother-in-law encouraged me to go for it," she added. "So, through time and...ups and downs, I grew older and wiser," said Farah.

62.title: Thousands recite Hanuman Chalisa in Jaipur in protest over tailor's murder
62.article_body: Thousands of people recited the Hanuman Chalisa on roads in Jaipur, following a silent procession organised by the "Sarva Hindu Samaj", in a protest over the beheading of a tailor in Udaipur on Sunday. Members of the VHP, RSS along with other Hindu organisations participated in the protest. A police official said that the protest was held peacefully.

63.title: Over 16,000 prospective parents waiting to adopt a child for past 3 years: Data
63.article_body: According to Central Adoption Resource Authority's (CARA) data, 16,155 prospective parents whose home study reports have been approved three years ago are still waiting for adoption. The officials of CARA attributed the slowdown to availability of fewer children who are legally free for adoption. As per the data on June 28, there are 3,596 children legally free for adoption.

64.title: India gifts 75 ambulances, 17 school buses to Nepali organisations
64.article_body: India has gifted 75 ambulances and 17 school buses to beneficiary organisations of Nepal on Sunday, the Embassy of India in Kathmandu tweeted. Indian Ambassador to Nepal Naveen Srivastava handed over the keys in the presence of Nepali minister Devendra Paudel. Srivastava highlighted that the gift "is part of a very robust and long-standing partnership between India and Nepal."

65.title: A 257-run lead is a long way now for England to chase: Vaughan
65.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said India's 257-run lead at the end of Day 3 in the ongoing Test is a "long way" for the Ben Stokes-led side to chase down. "India get another 150 and it's 400," he added. "A few of [England's] old traits have returned when...facing real quality. I see nothing but an India win," Vaughan further said.

66.title: Reports say Hrithik refused to shoot 'Vikram Vedha' in UP, makers clarify
66.article_body: Reliance Entertainment has reacted to reports claiming that the budget of 'Vikram Vedha' doubled after Hrithik Roshan refused to shoot in Uttar Pradesh and asked the makers to build a set depicting UP in Dubai. Calling the reports "misleading", Reliance Entertainment said, "We clearly want to state that Vikram Vedha has been shot extensively in India, including Lucknow."

67.title: Traffic movement to be slow in Mumbai's several places at 3:30 pm today
67.article_body: The Mumbai Traffic Police has announced that the vehicular movement around a few areas of Mumbai will be slowed down at 3:30 pm on Monday due to a planned VIP movement. "Traffic movement will be slow around Vidhan Bhavan, Haji Ali, Chaityabhoomi, Sea link, Bandra Kurla Complex connector, Eastern Express Highway, Anand Nagar toll plaza," the Mumbai Traffic Police tweeted.

68.title: Sania Mirza advances to QF of mixed doubles event at Wimbledon
68.article_body: India's Sania Mirza and her Croatian partner Mate Pavic have entered the quarter-finals of the mixed doubles event at Wimbledon on Sunday. The sixth-seeded pair reached the quarter-finals after their second-round opponents Ivan Dodig and Latisha Chan gave them a walkover. Notably, the duo will face the Australian-Canadian pair of John Peers and Gabriela Dabrowski in the quarter-finals on Monday.

69.title: We'll go to villages, find other workers: Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut
69.article_body: Following the political development in Maharashtra, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Monday said the party won’t weaken. "Our oxygen isn’t power…This (BJP and Eknath Shinde faction alliance) is a temporary arrangement," Raut added. "People come and go. They opted to join our party and left due to outside forces. We'll go to villages...find other workers," he stated.

70.title: Attempt to shut our critical work: Alt News rejects claims of receiving foreign funds
70.article_body: Fact-checking website Alt News on Monday issued a statement rejecting Delhi Police’s claims that its Co-founder Mohammed Zubair, Director of Pravda Media, received donations from Pakistan and Syria. It said, "Our payment platform through which we receive donations does not allow...funds from foreign sources...All of this is an attempt to shut down the very critical work that we do."

71.title: Oscar winner Pookutty calls RRR a 'gay love story', says Alia was used as prop in it
71.article_body: Oscar-winning film sound designer Resul Pookutty called RRR a 'gay love story' and tweeted that Alia Bhatt was used as a prop in the film. Reacting to his remarks, a Twitter user wrote, "Time and again people prove that no awards, position, rewards, money, fame have nothing to do with intelligence!" Another wrote, "Is that jealousy that is speaking?"

72.title: Vauld suspends trading, deposits & withdrawals citing 'financial difficulties'
72.article_body: Singapore-based cryptocurrency exchange Vauld has suspended all trading, withdrawals, and deposits on its platform. CEO Darshan Bathija said that the decision has been taken due to "volatile market conditions" and "financial difficulties" that its business partners are facing and is impacting them too. Founded in 2018, while Vauld is based in Singapore, most of its workforce is based in India.

73.title: Would've sat at home had the BJP told me to: Maha Deputy CM Fadnavis
73.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said he would have sat at home if Bharatiya Janata Party had told him to do so. "[It is] same party that made me Chief Minister...Today I tell you that there will never be a tussle for power in this govt...People taunt...it's an ED government...it's an ED government, government of Eknath Devendra," he added.

74.title: Conditions will vary a lot from venue to venue: Vettori on touring India
74.article_body: Australia's assistant coach Daniel Vettori has said that they will face challenges during their Indian tour as conditions will vary a lot from venue to venue. "Conditions will be very different...You could get anything in between [the pitches in Pakistan and Sri Lanka]. In Mohali, it will be flat, if you play at Wankhede, it could turn square," Vettori said.

75.title: Will take action as a dictator to tackle malpractices: Tamil Nadu CM
75.article_body: Addressing a party meeting of urban local body representatives, Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin said that people close to him say that he is acting in a "very democratic way" but anyone doing anything isn't democratic. "I'll take action as a dictator if malpractices arise. This isn't only for local body representatives but for all," he added.

76.title: Film poster shows goddess Kali smoking, director accused of hurting religious sentiments
76.article_body: Director Leena Manimekalai shared poster of her recent documentary, wherein goddess Kali is shown smoking. Several social media users accused Leena of hurting religious sentiments. "How can this be allowed to...release on digital platforms?" a user tweeted. Major Surendra Poonia wrote, "Madam, you...murdered...whole idea of respecting faith of 100 crore Hindus by showing goddess Kali as smoker."

77.title: Man run over by tempo after he falls asleep under it, dies in Pune
77.article_body: A 35-year-old man who was run over by a tempo after he fell asleep under the vehicle in Pune's Mangalwar Peth, has succumbed to his injuries. The deceased was apparently under the influence of alcohol and fell asleep under the tempo while taking shelter from the rain when the incident occurred. A case has been registered in the matter.

78.title: Hoarding with KCR's questions to PM Modi put up in Hyderabad
78.article_body: A hoarding showing Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao's questions to PM Narendra Modi was put up at Diamond Point Road near Parade Ground in Hyderabad. With a hashtag #ModiMustAnswer, KCR was shown questioning the PM on death of farmers during farm law protests and that of migrants during lockdown, promise to bring black money and privatisation of PSUs.

79.title: 19-year-old shooter Ankit arrested for Sidhu Moosewala's murder in Delhi
79.article_body: Delhi Police have arrested 19-year-old shooter Ankit along with his associate in Sidhu Moosewala murder case. Officers said Ankit is one of the shooters involved in Moosewala's murder and the other accused, Sachin, was responsible for harbouring four of the shooters after the killing. Police recovered two pistols, 19 live cartridges and three uniforms of Punjab Police from them.

80.title: He got a good delivery, that's how I'd describe it: Zaheer on Kohli's wicket
80.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli's dismissal during India's second innings in the ongoing Test against England, ex-India pacer Zaheer Khan said the ex-India captain "couldn't do much" on the delivery. "Kohli got a good delivery. That's how I would describe his dismissal...If a bowler gets you out with a good ball, what kind of analysis can you do?" stated Zaheer.

81.title: SC to hear Uddhav faction's plea against Speaker's decision on party whip
81.article_body: The Supreme Court has agreed to hear a plea by former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's faction against the Assembly Speaker Rahul Narwekar's decision to recognise Shiv Sena's new whip. The matter will be heard on July 11, after the court's summer break. "The Speaker has no jurisdiction to recognise whips," said senior advocate Abhishek Singhvi, representing the Thackeray group.

82.title: Ajay Devgn to direct Hindi remake of Tamil movie 'Kaithi'
82.article_body: Actor-director Ajay Devgn is all set to direct 'Bholaa' starring Tabu and himself in the lead roles. The upcoming film is the Hindi remake of 'Kaithi', a Tamil action-thriller which featured Karthi, Arjun Das and Narain among others in pivotal roles. Ajay has previously directed films like 'U Me Aur Hum', 'Shivaay' and 'Runway 34'.

83.title: Ronaldo has ego; wants to leave Man Utd because of Messi reason: Ex-player
83.article_body: Former Irish footballer Tony Cascarino has said that Manchester United's Cristiano Ronaldo wants to leave the English club because of the fear of Paris Saint-Germain's Lionel Messi overtaking him as UEFA Champions League's top goalscorer. "Ronaldo...has an ego... I'm a bit suspicious because he's got 141 goals in the Champions League. Messi has got 125," Cascarino said.

84.title: Court issues bailable warrant against Raut in ₹100 crore defamation case
84.article_body: A court in Mumbai on Monday issued a bailable warrant against Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut in a defamation case of ₹100 crore filed by BJP leader Kirit Somaiya's wife. The warrant was issued after Raut failed to appear before court. Earlier, Raut had claimed that Somaiya and his wife were involved in a public toilets scam worth ₹100 crore.

85.title: Farmers' body says govt didn't fulfil promises, warns of protests
85.article_body: Farmers' body Samyukta Kisan Morcha (SKM) on Sunday accused the Centre of not delivering on the promises made to them in exchange of withdrawing protests last year. It said that the government neither formed a committee on MSP nor withdrew cases against farmers. It said it will start an agitation, "Protest Against Betrayal", during the monsoon session of Parliament.

86.title: China asks Canada to 'stop meddling' in Hong Kong affairs
86.article_body: China has asked Canada to "stop meddling" in Hong Kong affairs. This comes after Canadian Foreign Minister Melanie Joly said that Hong Kong's freedom was being suppressed under Chinese authority. "Hong Kong affairs are purely China's internal affairs, and no external forces are in the position to make irresponsible remarks," said the Chinese embassy in Ottawa.

87.title: We should be prepared for people speaking against us: Fadnavis
87.article_body: Soon after the Eknath Shinde-led government proved its majority in Maharashtra Assembly, the state's Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said that everyone should be prepared to listen to adversary's voices in politics. "We've seen that people were jailed for making statements...We should be prepared for people speaking against us. We should respond to criticism but in a proper way," he said.

88.title: JD(U), BJP in search of their own Eknath Shinde: Chirag Paswan
88.article_body: Lok Janshakti Party’s (LJP) Chirag Paswan said that the JD(U) and its ally BJP were in search of "their own Eknath Shinde", in Bihar. Furthermore, Paswan said that the two parties are in alliance “just for the sake of power”. "Both are trying to pull the ally down," he added while addressing a press conference.

89.title: Twinkle attends Adele concert, pride walk with Akshay in London, shares video
89.article_body: Actress-turned-author Twinkle Khanna and Akshay Kumar attended Adele's concert and a pride walk in London recently. She took to Instagram on Sunday to share a video capturing "one of the best days of [her] life". "The best thing about...best day is it happens unexpectedly...Happiness is accidental...It only collides against you when you are looking the other way," she wrote.

90.title: Seniors forced me to massage their bodies, harassed me: Sprinter Dutee Chand
90.article_body: India's fastest female sprinter Dutee Chand revealed that her seniors used to force her to massage their bodies when she was at the sports hostel in Bhubaneswar. She added they also used to force her to wash their clothes. "When I opposed them...they used to harass me," she stated. "It used to take a mental toll on me," Dutee said.

91.title: Getting threat calls asking to not take Kerala CM's name: Swapna Suresh
91.article_body: Swapna Suresh, who is the prime accused in Kerala gold smuggling case, said that she is getting threat calls. "They are demanding not to take the names of Kerala CM, his wife, daughter and MLA KT Jaleel. Someone with the name of Maradu Aneesh is doing this...They are threatening to kill me," she added.

92.title: India to drop windfall tax if oil prices fall $40 a barrel: Revenue Secretary
92.article_body: India will withdraw its windfall tax for oil producers and refiners only if global prices of crude oil fall to $40 a barrel from present levels, said Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj. Last week, the Centre imposed a ₹23,230 per tonne additional tax on domestically produced crude oil to take away windfall gains accruing to producers from high international oil prices.

93.title: Heart-rending: PM Modi condoles loss of lives in Himachal bus accident
93.article_body: PM Narendra Modi condoled loss of lives in a bus accident in Himachal's Kullu and called the incident "heart-rending". "In this tragic hour my thoughts are with the bereaved families. I hope those injured recover at the earliest," PM said. He also announced ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh each for the next of kin of those who died in the accident.

94.title: Ex-MLA pays ₹20 lakh to hitmen to kill daughter in Bihar; arrested
94.article_body: A former MLA Surendra Sharma was apprehended on Sunday for allegedly ordering his daughter's "honour killing" after she married a man from another caste in Bihar's Patna, police said. The hitmen, whom Sharma paid ₹20 lakh, revealed the information, the city's SP (East) Pramod Kumar said. An attempt to kill the woman was made earlier this month, he added.

95.title: Gill, Vihari missed opportunity to cement their places: Jaffer on Eng Test
95.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer said Shubman Gill and Hanuma Vihari missed their opportunities to cement their place in India after failing to convert their knocks into big scores in the ongoing England Test. "Players like Sarfaraz Khan are knocking on the door and even Suryakumar Yadav is available. So yes to some extent [they have missed a chance]," stated Jaffer.

96.title: Neither yours nor for your son, it’s BJP’s turn: Shah to KCR on T'gana CM post
96.article_body: Union Home Minister and BJP leader Amit Shah on Sunday said as the country moves forward, Telangana is lagging behind. "KCR (Telangana CM) doesn't care about your source of livelihood…He just wants to make his son CM. KCR, the next turn is neither yours nor for your son. The next turn is meant for the BJP," Shah said in Hyderabad.

97.title: Federer receives standing ovation as he enters Wimbledon's Centre Court, video viral
97.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Roger Federer receiving a standing ovation as he entered the Wimbledon's Centre Court for a ceremony on Sunday. The ceremony marked the centenary of Centre Court. "Of course, I’ve missed being here. I would have loved to be here," said Federer, who is not taking part in the ongoing Wimbledon.

98.title: Delhi man hits 3 members of a family, strikes their dog's head with iron rod over barking
98.article_body: A man attacked three members of a family in Delhi and struck their dog on its head with an iron pipe after it barked at him. He also picked up the dog by its tail and threw it away. The dog's owner intervened, leading to a scuffle with the man, who was bitten by the dog in the meantime.

99.title: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde wins trust vote
99.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde-led state government proved its majority in the Assembly on Monday as it surpassed the majority mark of 144. It comes a day after BJP's Rahul Narwekar was elected the Assembly Speaker. Earlier in the day, Narwekar reinstated CM Eknath Shinde as Shiv Sena legislature party leader.

100.title: Tiger Shroff to team up with Shashank Khaitan for an action film: Reports
100.article_body: Actor Tiger Shroff and filmmaker Shashank Khaitan are reportedly teaming up for an action film. Production is expected to begin in August in Portugal. According to reports, the yet-untitled film will be shot at Belém Tower, Aveiro, Serra da Estrela (Portugal's highest mountain range) and the Palácio Nacional da Pena among many others. Tiger is currently working on 'Ganapath'.

101.title: Chanderpaul, who scored over 10,000 Test runs, appointed coach of US women teams
101.article_body: Ex-West Indies batter Shivnarine Chanderpaul has been appointed head coach of the US senior women's and the Under-19 teams for 18 months. "I've enjoyed being involved in American cricket over the years as a resident of Orlando, so to be given this opportunity...is incredible," stated Chanderpaul, who's one of the 14 cricketers to score more than 10,000 Test runs.

102.title: Tesla free to come but its special treatment not in India's interest: Ola CEO
102.article_body:
Ola Electric's CEO Bhavish Aggarwal has said, "Tesla is free to come in and put up a shop here...They just want to be treated differently from others, which I believe isn't in the interests of India." Earlier, Tesla CEO Elon Musk had said the company won't build its manufacturing
plant in any location where it can't sell its cars first.

103.title: 12-year-old cancer patient made Prayagraj Police ADG for a day
103.article_body: A 12-year-old cancer patient was made the Additional Director General (ADG) of Prayagraj Police for a day. ADG (Prayagraj zone), Prem Prakash, also gifted a body kit to the boy. Reports said that the boy asked questions about the police functioning and also browsed the documents while sitting on chair of ADG. He reportedly also signed and forwarded some reports.

104.title: 77 including 23 kids kept in church's basement, freed in Nigeria
104.article_body: Police have freed 77 people, including 23 children, kept in a church's basement in Nigeria's Ondo by pastors preaching to them about Christian believers ascending to heaven with Jesus Christ's second coming, authorities said. The incident came to light after a woman raised an alarm over a possible kidnapping, locals said. Two pastors are in custody, a police spokesperson said.

105.title: 31 bodies, some decomposing, found at funeral home in US
105.article_body: As many as 31 bodies were found at a funeral home in US' Indiana, following which the police launched an investigation. Some bodies were said to be in the advanced stages of decomposition. The cremated remains of 16 people were also found at the Lankford Funeral Home and Family Center. The remains were taken to the coroner's office for identification.

106.title: Congress in Gujarat exists only on paper: Arvind Kejriwal
106.article_body: AAP National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal said Congress party in Gujarat largely exists only on paper. "The office-bearers of AAP have to ensure that not a single vote is cast for Congress in Assembly elections," Kejriwal added. "We'll have our booth level organisation in place next month. By then, we'll have built an organisation bigger than BJP in Gujarat," he stated.

107.title: Pant did no wonders, it was England bowlers' fault: Mohammad Asif
107.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Mohammad Asif has said India's Rishabh Pant's 146(111) during their first innings in the ongoing Test against England was "England bowlers' fault". He added, "Pant did no wonders...he managed to score a century because English bowlers didn't bowl to him in his weak areas." With his hundred, Pant has become the youngest wicketkeeper-batter to reach 2,000 Test runs.

108.title: Opposing car shed at Aarey is like opposing environment: Fadnavis
108.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis has said that opposing the metro car shed project in Aarey colony is like opposing the environment. "This is a metro line that is in the interests of Mumbaikars...it will end the congestion and pollution in Mumbai," Fadnavis said. "Hence, we will evolve a consensus and complete this work," Fadnavis added.

109.title: India's Tejas is Malaysia's 'top choice' for MiG-29 replacement: HAL chief
109.article_body: India's light combat aircraft Tejas has emerged as Malaysia's "top choice" for replacing its fleet of Russian MiG-29 fighter planes, Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) chairman R Madhavan said. "I am very confident about the deal, unless some political shift takes place," Madhavan added. If the deal is sealed, it will give a "very good signal" to other buyers, he said.

110.title: Spartan Poker's 'Spartanverse' aims to lead metaverse gaming revolution
110.article_body: Online poker platform Spartan Poker announced its entry into the metaverse with the launch of 'Spartanverse'. Honouring legends of the Indian poker fraternity, it has a virtual Hall-of-Fame, hosting all the winners of India Online Poker Championship (IOPC), it revealed. "(It's the) first step towards building an immersive, virtual and futuristic poker experience," Founder & CEO Amin Rozani added.

111.title: Kishore said Madhubala had hole in heart, will live for 2 yrs: Actress' sister
111.article_body: Late actress Madhubala's sister Madhur Bhushan said that late singer Kishore Kumar had broken the news of Madhubala having a hole in her heart to her family and had said she will live only for two years. She added that Kumar had told them there is no cure for her condition and that their mother had fainted upon hearing news.

112.title: Prabhas is super friendly, he feeds people with so much love: Co-star Shruti
112.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan opened up about her experience of working with Prabhas in the upcoming film 'Salaar'. Calling him "super chilled out" and "super friendly", Shruti said it was really nice to work with him. She further said Prabhas feeds people with "so much love", adding that it's one of his best qualities. 'Salaar' is expected to release in 2023.

113.title: Video captures moment glacier collapses in Italian Alps; 6 killed, 8 injured
113.article_body: Parts of a mountain glacier collapsed in the Italian Alps on Sunday amid record temperatures, local authorities said, killing at least six people and injuring eight. A video has captured the moment an ice mass collapsed down the slopes of Marmolada, which at more than 3,300 metres is the highest mountain in the Dolomites.

114.title: It was reckless batting: Pietersen on Stokes' wicket in 5th Test vs India
114.article_body: Ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen has criticised England captain Ben Stokes for his batting during their first innings in the ongoing Test against India. "I was watching Stokes run down the wicket and slog the ball straight into the air. It was reckless batting...He's too good a player [for] this," stated Pietersen. Stokes was dropped twice before being dismissed on 25(36).

115.title: People say Kishore converted to Islam to marry, that's not true: Madhubala's sister
115.article_body: Talking about late singer Kishore Kumar's marriage with Madhubala, the late actress' youngest sister said, "A lot of people say that Kishore had converted to Islam to marry Madhu apa, but that’s not true." She added, "He was a Hindu and he passed away a Hindu. None of the husbands who married into our family changed their religion."

116.title: Maha Speaker reinstates Eknath Shinde as Shiv Sena legislature party leader
116.article_body: Maharashtra Assembly Speaker, Rahul Narwekar, has reinstated state Chief Minister Eknath Shinde as Shiv Sena legislative party leader. The Speaker has also reinstated Bharat Gogawale as the party's Chief Whip. News Agency ANI reported that appointment of Ajay Chaudhary as legislative party leader has been set aside by the Speaker.

117.title: Goenka shares pic with 'lookalike' Maharashtra CM, says 'My security can be a nuisance'
117.article_body: RPG Enterprises' Chairman Harsh Goenka on Sunday tweeted a photo of himself with Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde while referring to the similarities in their appearance. Goenka tweeted, "To those who come to meet me, sorry for any [inconvenience]. I know my Z+ security can be a nuisance. Look forward to your support. Jai Maharashtra!"

118.title: Overcast conditions, light showers likely in Delhi today: IMD
118.article_body: Overcast conditions are likely to prevail in Delhi on Monday, with the city likely to get 'light to moderate' thundershowers in the evening. According to the forecast of the India Meteorological Department (IMD), the minimum temperature in the capital will be around 27 degrees Celsius, while the maximum temperature will be 36 degrees Celsius.

119.title: Will give all donations to charity: Amazon delivery boy who saved Thane girl
119.article_body: An Amazon delivery agent, who helped in saving a child after part of a metal gate pierced through her cheek while she was playing in her school in Thane, said that he would give all the money he received as donations to charity. "My phone has been ringing constantly...with people from several states in India calling me," the agent said.

120.title: 16, including school children, dead after private bus falls into gorge in Himachal's Kullu
120.article_body: At least 16 people, including some school children, died after a private bus fell into a gorge in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu district. The bus was travelling from Shansher to Sainj when the incident happened. The driver reportedly lost control and the bus fell 200 metres into the gorge. The bus is said to be carrying more than 40 passengers.

121.title: 50-yr-old labourer falls off 6th floor in Delhi, contractor booked
121.article_body: A 50-year-old labourer was severely injured after falling off the sixth floor of a building undergoing repair in Delhi's Dwarka. The police booked the contractor after the victim complained that he did not provide proper equipment for work. The victim said that despite flagging the danger of using a loosely-tied bamboo seat for work, the contractor didn't make suitable arrangements.

122.title: India sees 16,135 new COVID-19 cases, 24 deaths; active cases reach 1,13,864
122.article_body: India has reported 16,135 COVID-19 cases, 13,958 recoveries and 24 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 16,103 cases and 31 deaths. Notably, India's active COVID-19 cases jumped to 1,13,864, while the death toll reached 5,25,223.

123.title: 25 dead, 53 injured in Mumbai last month due to monsoon mishaps: BMC data
123.article_body: Mumbai witnessed 25 deaths and 53 people were injured in more than 600 rain-related incidents in June, according to Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) data. The highest number of victims (19 deaths) were reported in the Kurla building collapse incident. The civic body has identified 382 dilapidated buildings this monsoon season, of which people still reside in 199 such buildings.

124.title: Why don’t you rename Ahmedabad to Adanibad?: KTR on BJP’s demand to rename Hyd
124.article_body: After BJP leader and ex-Jharkhand CM Raghubar Das said Hyderabad’s name will be changed to Bhagyanagar if BJP comes to power in Telangana, TRS leader KT Rama Rao asked, "Why don’t you change Ahmedabad’s name to Adanibad first?" Meanwhile, speaking about BJP’s national executive meet, BJP’s Ravi Shankar Prasad said, "PM Modi said that Hyderabad is Bhagyanagar."

125.title: 4 killed, 7 injured in lightning strikes in UP's Sitapur
125.article_body: Four people were killed and seven others injured after being struck by lightning in separate incidents in Uttar Pradesh’s Sitapur on Sunday. Two of the deceased were working in a field when they were struck by lightning. The SDM said that district administration will provide ₹4 lakh as financial compensation to the deceased’s families. The bodies were sent for post-mortem.

126.title: Iran cuts price of its crude oil in China amid competition with Russia: Report
126.article_body: Iran has discounted its crude oil price in China amid competition with Russia, as per a report. Russian exports to China surged to a record level in May, making it China's biggest supplier of oil and displacing Saudi Arabia from that position. Notably, China's official data only lists three months of imports from Iran since the end of 2020.

127.title: When I got a call for 'Ms Marvel', I had to pinch myself: Farhan
127.article_body: Actor Farhan Akhtar, who plays the role of Waleed in 'Ms Marvel', has said he's a huge fan of Marvel Cinematic Universe. "So when I got a call from my agent...that 'They're looking for someone out of India and are hoping you'll do this part,' I'd to pinch myself," he added. Farhan appeared in the fourth episode of the show.

128.title: We had to stay patient, wait for England batters to make mistakes: Siraj
128.article_body: After England were bundled out for 284 in their first innings in the ongoing rescheduled Test, India's Mohammed Siraj said they focused on the basics and waited for the England batters to make mistakes. He added that the plan was to hit one area consistently as the ball was "keeping low" on occasions. India ended Day 3 at 125/3.

129.title: Lalu Prasad Yadav falls from stairs at wife's home, fractures shoulder; hospitalised
129.article_body: Rashtriya Janata Dal leader Lalu Prasad Yadav was admitted to Paras Hospital in Patna. He was hospitalised after he reportedly lost his balance and fell down the stairs at his wife Rabri Devi's residence yesterday. News agency ANI reported that Yadav has suffered a minor fracture in his right shoulder, following which, his health deteriorated.

130.title: Neesham trolls Kohli for sledging Bairstow, says 'Give him a gift basket each morning'
130.article_body: New Zealand all-rounder Jimmy Neesham trolled Virat Kohli for sledging Jonny Bairstow on Day 3 of the rescheduled fifth Test. "Why do opposing teams keep making...Bairstow angry lol, he gets 10x better," Neesham wrote. He added, "Give him a gift basket each morning, let him know you're having his car valeted while he's batting. Anything to keep him happy."

131.title: Team India opener smashes fifty in a Test at Edgbaston for the first time after 36 years
131.article_body: Cheteshwar Pujara on Sunday became the first India opener to smash a fifty in a Test at Edgbaston in 36 years. Prior to Pujara, Sunil Gavaskar was the last India opener to smash a Test fifty at Edgbaston in 1986. Between Gavaskar and Pujara's fifties, Gautam Gambhir's 38(64) in 2011 was the highest score by an India opener at Edgbaston.

132.title: Broke leg, hand gestures became famous as Bobby Deol style: Bobby on 'Gupt...'
132.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol said that he had broken his leg while shooting for the movie 'Barsaat'. "And 'Gupt: The Hidden Truth' was immediately after that. I had an accident on the former's last day, so Chinni and Rekha Prakash ji made those hand movements of mine, which became popular as 'Bobby Deol's style'," he added.

133.title: Sri Lanka extends school closures amid unprecedented fuel crisis
133.article_body: Sri Lanka extended school closures for one more week starting July 4 amid unprecedented fuel crisis. The government and state-approved private schools will remain closed as there's not enough fuel for teachers and parents to get children to classrooms. Last month, the schools were shut nationwide for a day and remained closed in urban areas for the last two weeks.

134.title: Policeman shot at by terrorists in his home in J&K's Anantnag
134.article_body: A policeman was injured after he was shot at by terrorists in his home in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag on Sunday, police officials said. A police spokesperson said that the policeman had been taken to a hospital. "Investigation is in progress and officers continue to work to establish the full circumstances of this terror crime," an officer said.

135.title: Over 1 million people got jobs in past 2 yrs on Rozgar Bazaar: Delhi govt
135.article_body: The Delhi government has claimed that over one million people got jobs through its digital job matching portal, Rozgar Bazaar since its launch on July 27, 2020. Jobs across 32 job categories have been generated till June 2022, the government said. Notably, the platform was launched to help entry-level and blue-collar job seekers connect with employers during COVID-19-induced lockdown.

136.title: Harshal smashes 54(36) as India win 2nd T20 warm-up match by 10 runs
136.article_body: Team India defeated Northamptonshire by 10 runs to win the second and final T20 warm-up game on Sunday. India were 8/3 at one point in the game but Harshal Patel smashed 54 off 36 to help his side reach 149/8. The 31-year-old then picked two wickets, conceding 23 runs as Northamptonshire were bundled out for 139 in 19.3 overs.

137.title: Organs of brain dead auto-rickshaw driver save 4 lives in Delhi
137.article_body: A 45-year-old auto-rickshaw driver from Bihar, Karu Singh, was declared brain dead at Delhi's AIIMS. His family decided to donate his organs, which helped save four patients' lives. Singh's heart was transplanted to a 40-year-old woman, his liver to a 62-year-old man, one of his kidneys to a 56-year-old woman and the other to a 37-year-old woman.

138.title: Half genuine, half sponsored: Fadnavis on protests against Aarey car shed
138.article_body: The newly elected Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said that the issue created around shifting Metro-3 car shed project back to Aarey is "half genuine and half sponsored" and added that it was "only solution to Mumbai's congestion". "Work was paused after 25% of it had been completed. The cost has already been escalated by ₹10,000 crore," Fadnavis further said.

139.title: Firm loses ₹15 lakh from account in suspected cyber attack in Pune
139.article_body: An engineering firm lost ₹15 lakh from its bank account within hours in an alleged cyber attack in Pune. According to the FIR, the money was siphoned off after a beneficiary was fraudulently added in the firm's bank account and the transaction limit was raised from ₹2 lakh. The money was siphoned in six transfers, added the FIR.

140.title: We rob bank, you rob whole nation; Bye Bye Modi: Money Heist posters in Hyd
140.article_body: 'Money Heist' themed poster was seen in Hyderabad amid the BJP national executive meeting. "We only rob bank, you rob the whole nation," the poster said, adding, "Bye Bye Modi." The poster also mentioned names of states including Uttarakhand, Arunachal Pradesh, Karnataka, Maharashtra and Bihar. Reports said photos and videos of 'Money Heist' mascots on Hyderabad streets were also shared.

141.title: Truck hits 4 vehicles after brakes fail in Pune; 3 killed, 2 hurt
141.article_body: Three people, including an infant, were killed and two others injured after a truck hit two cars and two bikes near Lavale Phata in Pune on Sunday. The truck, which was carrying tiles, was on a steep slope when the driver lost control as the vehicle's brakes apparently failed, according to officials. The truck driver was arrested in the matter.

142.title: Rohit Sharma tests negative for COVID-19, begins net practice
142.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma is out of isolation and was seen at the nets after having tested negative for COVID-19. Rohit missed the ongoing rescheduled Test against England after he tested positive during the four-day warm-up game against Leicestershire. He's expected to be available for the white-ball series against England that begins with the first T20I on July 7.

143.title: Lost states because of BJP's superior money power: Cong's Abhishek Singhvi
143.article_body: Congress leader Abhishek Singhvi said the party lost some states because of the "climate of fear", successfully created by the PM Narendra Modi-led government by misusing central agencies. On being asked, from Karnataka to Maharashtra, non-BJP parties have not been able to retain power in many states, Singhvi said, "Yes, we've lost these states because of BJP's superior money power."

144.title: British Army's Twitter & YouTube briefly hacked, posts made on NFTs & Musk
144.article_body: The British Army regained control of its Twitter and YouTube accounts on Sunday after they were briefly hacked. While the YouTube channel was renamed 'Ark Invest' and videos on cryptocurrency with images of the world's richest man Elon Musk appeared there, the Twitter account retweeted several posts related to NFTs. The Army later said it will investigate the incident.

145.title: 22-year-old gunman opens fire at Denmark mall; 3 killed, several wounded
145.article_body: A gunman opened fire inside a busy shopping mall in Copenhagen on Sunday, killing three people and critically wounding three others, police said. A 22-year-old Danish man was arrested after the shooting, police added. According to police, the victims included a man in his 40s and two young people while several others were injured, three of them critically.

146.title: Who is 21-year-old Sini Shetty, winner of Miss India 2022?
146.article_body: Sini Shetty, who has been crowned Miss India 2022, was born in Maharashtra's Mumbai and is 21 years old. She hails from Karnataka. She did her schooling from St Dominic Savio Vidyalaya in Mumbai. She holds a bachelor's degree in accounting and finance and is currently pursuing a course in Chartered Finance Analyst (CFA). She is also a Bharatanatyam dancer.

147.title: History-sheeter arrested for stealing gold, silver from Pune flat
147.article_body: A 34-year-old man was arrested for breaking into a Pune flat and stealing about a kilogram of gold and three kilograms of silver ornaments. The incident occurred on June 20, when the target family had gone out to buy a puppy. According to the police, the accused is a history-sheeter with 18 cases of burglary against him.

148.title: 17-yr-old boy fined ₹17,500 for posting bike stunt videos in B'luru
148.article_body: A 17-year-old boy who performed bike stunts and posted them on social media was fined ₹17,500 in Bengaluru, police said on Sunday. Cases were filed based on the videos, which showed the stunts could be "dangerous" for others, Joint Police Commissioner (Traffic) BR Ravikanthe Gowda said. As the boy is a minor, cases were filed against his parents, he added.

149.title: Hyd man killed, body set ablaze by wife's family for marrying against choice
149.article_body: A 25-year-old man, a resident of Hyderabad, was killed and his body was set on fire by his wife's family as they objected to couple's marriage. Police said the two got married last year but wife's family did not approve of their marriage and forcibly took her away. Her family called victim on pretext of resolving differences and killed him.

150.title: Shinde govt may fall in next 6 months, be prepared for mid-term polls: Pawar
150.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar said that the newly formed Eknath Shinde-led government in Maharashtra is likely to fall in the next six months and everyone should be prepared for mid-term elections in the state. He further added that many rebel MLAs are not happy with the current arrangement and once the ministerial portfolios are distributed, their unrest will come out.

151.title: MCD doubles fines for mosquito breeding at houses, construction sites
151.article_body: Municipal Corporation of Delhi has doubled the fine for mosquito breeding in households, offices and construction sites as well as in containers in home and office spaces. As per the new slab, for residential areas, the fines have been increased to ₹100 per container from ₹50 and for commercial office and educational premises, it has become ₹200 from ₹100.

152.title: Karnataka's 21-year-old Sini Shetty crowned Miss India 2022
152.article_body: Mumbai-born 21-year-old Sini Shetty, who hails from Karnataka, was named Miss India 2022 at the 58th Femina Miss India beauty pageant. Miss India 2020 Manasa Varanasi crowned Sini, who will go on to represent India at the next edition of the Miss World pageant. Meanwhile, 21-year-old Shinata Chauhan was declared the second runner-up and Rubal Shekhawat was named first runner-up.

153.title: Cheteshwar Pujara slams fifty as India lead England by 257 runs after Day 3
153.article_body: India ended the third day of the rescheduled fifth Test at 125/3 in the second innings, leading England by 257 runs. Cheteshwar Pujara is unbeaten on 50*(139), while Rishabh Pant is unbeaten on 30*(46). Earlier in the day, England were dismissed for 284 runs in their first innings, with Mohammed Siraj picking four wickets.

154.title: North Korea criticises US, South Korea, Japan tripartite agreement
154.article_body: Pyongyang has criticised the recent agreement between the US, South Korea and Japan to explore further means of reinforcing "extended deterrence" against North Korea. It said the agreement materialises an alliance like NATO. Pyongyang also said the US is "spreading rumour" about a "threat from North Korea" to gain military supremacy over the Asia-Pacific, North Korean state media reported Sunday.

155.title: Russian ship with stolen Ukrainian wheat held in Turkey: Ukraine
155.article_body: Turkish customs authorities have detained a Russian cargo ship carrying wheat stolen from Ukrainian territory, Ukraine's ambassador to Turkey said on Sunday. He said a future course of action regarding the ship will be reached after a meeting of investigators on Monday. Ukraine had previously asked Turkey to detain the ship, as per documents and an official cited by Reuters.

156.title: Working to fully safeguard US users' data: TikTok to US lawmakers
156.article_body: ByteDance owned TikTok has told US senators that it was working on an agreement to "fully safeguard user data and US national security interests," as per a letter. This comes amid claims that the social media app has leaked US user data to China. TikTok acknowledged that in the past Chinese employees had data access to US user data.

157.title: Twitter banned more than 46,000 accounts in India in May
157.article_body: Twitter banned more than 46,000 accounts of Indian users in May over violation of its guidelines, it said in its monthly compliance report on Sunday. While 43,656 accounts were removed over child sexual exploitation, non-consensual nudity, and similar content, some 2,870 accounts were banned for promoting terrorism. Between April 26 and May 25, Twitter received 1,698 complaints in India.

158.title: 102 people killed in Bangladesh floods so far
158.article_body: The death toll due to the floods in Bangladesh has reached 102, the country's Directorate General of Health Services said. The government agency said that among the deceased, 75 died by drowning, 15 from lightning strikes, two from snake bites, and the rest due to other reasons. The agency said the deaths occurred between May 17 and July 3.

159.title: Pavithra Lokesh claims media representatives stalking her, files complaint
159.article_body: Telugu and Kannada actress Pavithra Lokesh has filed a complaint in Mysuru's VV Puram Police Station claiming that some representatives of the media are stalking her. The actress has stated that they are destroying her peace of mind. She had earlier alleged that fake accounts with her name were made on social media that are making defamatory posts.

160.title: Sainz claims first F1 win at British GP after crash delays the race
160.article_body: Carlos Sainz won first career Formula One race on his 150th start at the British Grand Prix on Sunday. The Ferrari driver beat Red Bull's Sergio Perez and Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton. Part one of the race was red-flagged as Alfa Romeo driver Zhou Guanyu was stretchered off after a major crash on turn one. Championship leader Max Verstappen finished seventh.

161.title: WhatsApp may increase time limit of 'delete for everyone' feature: Report
161.article_body: Meta-owned messaging platform WhatsApp is beta testing the option to increase the time limit for its 'delete for everyone' feature, as per reports. According to WABetaInfo, which offers real-time updates about WhatsApp, the feature has been rolled out for beta testing to a limited number of users. The new limit for the update may be two days and 12 hours.

162.title: Amazon lets Prime users unsubscribe in 2 clicks after EU complaints
162.article_body: The European Commission has said that after complaints from consumer groups, Amazon has made it easier for users to cancel their Prime subscriptions in the region. Users can now unsubscribe with two clicks via a prominent and clear 'cancel button', the Commission said. As per the complaints, users had to earlier go through complicated menus, skewed wording and confusing choices.

163.title: Why is Australia killing millions of honeybees?
163.article_body: Australian authorities have killed over six million honeybees after an outbreak of the deadly varroa mite that was first reported in Sydney last week. The parasitic insect, known to be the biggest threat to bees worldwide, attacks and feeds on honeybees, crippling them and impairing their flight performance. The extermination is being done to save Australia's multimillion-dollar honey industry.

164.title: Don’t blame me: Rohit Shetty on high budget of Khatron Ke Khiladi 12
164.article_body: When asked if he's the reason why the budget of 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12' has increased, filmmaker Rohit Shetty replied, "Don’t blame me. 'Khatron Ke Khiladi' is an expensive show, I think by far one of the most expensive ones." "The scale and quality of the show require that kind of...budget. It has nothing to do with me," he added.

165.title: Sri Lanka struggling to raise $587mn to pay for fuel shipments: Lankan Minister
165.article_body: Sri Lanka needs to pay $587 million for several fuel shipments, said a top minister amid its worst financial crisis and crippling fuel shortage. The country is struggling to raise enough funds to pay for essential imports of items like fuel, food and medicines. Its central bank can supply only about $125 million, Power and Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera said.

166.title: Madhubala's biopic will not include Kishore Kumar & Dilip Kumar: Madhur
166.article_body: Madhubala's sister Madhur Bhushan said the family wants to celebrate the actor through the biopic. "We are sure that we don’t want to hurt anybody while telling this tale. We don’t want to get into what happened with Dilip Kumar and Kishore Kumar," she added. "They've families, wives and children, too. Every relationship has its ups and downs," she said.

167.title: Two dead as boulder crushes car in Uttarakhand's Chamoli district
167.article_body: A couple was killed on Sunday in Uttarakhand's Chamoli district when a boulder rolled down a hill and crushed the car they were travelling in, police said. The accident took place on the Karnaprayag-Gwaldam national highway, police added. The deceased have been identified as 42-year-old Balbir Singh and his 40-year-old wife Savitri Devi.

168.title: Delhi govt adds Jagannath Puri Yatra under its free pilgrimage scheme
168.article_body: Delhi government will be sending pilgrims for Jagannath Puri Yatra in Odisha under its free pilgrimage scheme, officials said on Sunday. Two trains under the 'Mukhyamantri Tirth Yatra Yojana' will depart for Puri with the pilgrims on July 11 and July 28. The scheme, which was introduced in 2019, was suspended due to the pandemic and resumed in December 2021.

169.title: FPIs withdraw ₹50,203 crore in June, highest net outflow in 2 years
169.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) withdrew a net sum of ₹50,203 crore from equities in June, data showed. This is the highest net outflow since March 2020, when they pulled out ₹61,973 crore. Overall, in the first six months of 2022, FPIs pulled out around ₹2.2 lakh crore from domestic equities, which is the highest-ever net withdrawal by them.

170.title: NDMC plans to launch mobile education vans for labourers' children
170.article_body: The New Delhi Municipal Corporation (NDMC) plans to launch mobile school vans to educate labourers' kids and homeless kids. NDMC Vice Chairperson Satish Upadhyay said that before implementation, a feasibility survey will be conducted to identify the number of such students. Lauding Gujarat's 'school on wheels' initiative, he said that they will contact Gujarat education department for ideas.

171.title: HC to hear plea alleging Ram Rahim has been replaced with impostor
171.article_body: The Punjab & Haryana HC will hear a plea on Monday that seeks to "verify the authenticity" of Gurmeet Ram Rahim and ascertain if he has been replaced with an impostor. The petitioners, who have claimed to be followers of Dera Sacha Sauda, have listed multiple changes they claim they have noticed in Ram Rahim's figure and personality.

172.title: JSW Steel to invest ₹10,000cr to reduce carbon footprint: Chairman
172.article_body: JSW Steel has earmarked ₹10,000 crore for investments to reduce its carbon footprint, JSW Group Chairman Sajjan Jindal said. He added that this will be done by increasing the use of renewable energy to replace thermal power and reduce the firm's fuel rate, among others. "We have committed to reducing our CO2 emissions intensity...by 42% by 2030," Jindal said.

173.title: Chip business turnover expected to be around $3.5bn: Vedanta Group
173.article_body: Vedanta Group's global MD of display and semiconductor business Akarsh Hebbar said the firm expects its semiconductor business turnover to be in the range of $3 to $3.5 billion. "This will be from both display and semiconductor combined...We expect $1 billion to come from exports," he added. The firm has earmarked investments of up to $20 billion for the business.

174.title: Four of a family killed in Lakhimpur Kheri as bus hits motorcycle
