174.article_body: Four members of a family, including three females, were killed in a road accident in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri on Sunday when a speeding bus hit their motorcycle, police said. The deceased, including a 7-year-old girl, were identified as residents of Dhaurahra village. The bodies have been sent for post-mortem and the driver of the bus has been arrested, police added.

175.title: Health emergency declared in Puducherry district over diarrhoea outbreak
175.article_body: Puducherry's Directorate of Health and Family Welfare Services has declared a public health emergency in Karaikal district, following an outbreak of acute diarrhoea over the last few days. Examination of drinking water samples in the region was found to be not safe for consumption, the  Health Director said. Citizens have been asked to drink boiled water and ensure personal hygiene.

176.title: PM Modi said that Hyderabad is Bhagyanagar: Ravi Shankar Prasad
176.article_body: Speaking about BJP's national executive meet in Hyderabad, BJP MP Ravi Shankar Prasad said, "PM Modi said that Hyderabad is Bhagyanagar which is significant for all of us." "Sardar Patel kept the foundation of a unified India and now it's BJP's responsibility to carry it further," he added. PM Modi addressed the meet on Sunday.

177.title: I have a dream that once I will do a negative role: Ranbir
177.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor said he once wants to play a negative role. "I've a dream that once I'll do a negative role and people will tell their kids ‘so jaa, so jaa nahi toh Ranbir aa jayega!'" "As our cinema evolves, the villain's character...is becoming complex and interesting. I’m looking forward to the bad guys we're yet to watch," he added.

178.title: Sorry had to kick out British player Watson: Jule on Wimbledon 4th round win
178.article_body: Germany's Jule Niemeier has entered maiden Grand Slam quarter-final on her Wimbledon debut, defeating Great Britain's Heather Watson 6-2, 6-4 in the fourth round on Sunday. "I can't believe it. I want to say sorry I had to kick out a British player today. The atmosphere was incredible," said Niemeier. The 22-year-old will now face compatriot Tatjana Maria.

179.title: Will restrain Centre from destabilising Oppn state govts: Sinha
179.article_body: The Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha has said that he won't hesitate to restrain Centre if it "aids and abets" the destabilisation of state governments run by Opposition parties. "I have declared that I shall speak out against any attempts aimed at communal polarisation...I have also announced that I shall work for the repeal of the sedition law," Sinha added.

180.title: Films don't fail, budgets do; producer shouldn't lose money: Taapsee
180.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu stated that films don't fail but budgets do, adding that it's a universal fact irrespective of whether it's Bollywood or Hollywood. "The most important fact should be that your producers shouldn't be losing money, this is true for an actor and actress," she added. Taapsee further said it is an actor's duty to keep that in mind.

181.title: 34-yr-old mother-of-two Maria enters 1st Slam singles quarters at Wimbledon
181.article_body: Unseeded German Tatjana Maria saved two match points to beat 12th seeded Jelena Ostapenko 5-7, 7-5, 7-5 in the fourth round at Wimbledon and reached her first Grand Slam singles quarter-final on Sunday. Notably, the 34-year-old mother of two, who returned from maternity leave less than a year ago, is the oldest player left in the women's draw.

182.title: Russian scientist dies days after arrest for state treason
182.article_body: A scientist who was arrested from Siberia earlier this week by Russian authorities on charges of state treason has died, his lawyer told Reuters on Sunday. Dmitry Kolker's lawyer said, "He died yesterday. Tomorrow we will lodge a complaint over his detention." Kolker was reportedly suffering from advanced pancreatic cancer. According to Kolker's family, he was detained from a hospital.

183.title: Cristiano Ronaldo wants to leave Manchester United: Reports
183.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo has told the Premier League club that he wants to leave the club because of his desire to play in the Champions League, UK's The Times newspaper reported on Saturday. The report added that the 37-year-old Portuguese footballer believes that he can play at the elite level for another "three of four years".

184.title: Pic of Tom Cruise's stunt from new 'Mission Impossible' surfaces
184.article_body: A picture has surfaced online showing actor Tom Cruise dangling from the wing of a plane as it does a nosedive and then performs a barrel roll. The stunt is from his upcoming film 'Mission: Impossible – Dead Reckoning Part One'. Tom reportedly also rides a motorcycle off the edge of a cliff and parachutes off in the film.

185.title: Katariya scores as India hold England to 1-1 draw in their women's hockey WC 2022 opener
185.article_body: Vandana Katariya scored in the 28th minute as India held England to a 1-1 draw in their women's hockey World Cup 2022 opener on Sunday. Katariya's equaliser came 19 minutes after England's Isabelle Petter opened the scoring. India will next face China in their Pool B clash on Tuesday. The World Cup is being held in Spain and Netherlands.

186.title: Hope to play Wimbledon one more time: 8-time champion Federer
186.article_body: Eight-time champion Roger Federer said he hopes to play Wimbledon "one more time". Attending a special ceremony to mark the 100th anniversary of Centre Court on Sunday, Federer stated, "This court has given me my biggest wins and my biggest losses." The Swiss hasn't played a competitive match since losing in quarter-final of last year's Championships to Poland's Hubert Hurkacz.

187.title: Pics show the moment a woman was eaten by shark in Egypt
187.article_body: A footage of a 68-year-old tourist from Austria being attacked by a shark in Egypt has surfaced online, following which the country's Red Sea Governorate ordered closure of several Red Sea beaches. The woman died in an ambulance after losing an arm and a leg in the attack. The footage showed the woman trying to swim back to shore.

188.title: I should have been a mom at 19, I was ready but it got delayed: Sushmita
188.article_body: Speaking about becoming a mother, actress Sushmita Sen said she wanted to adopt much earlier. "I was delayed as far as I was concerned, I should've been a mom at 19, I was ready," she said. "I...knew it was time and during Miss Universe is the first time I entered an adoption centre...Something inside [me] was not okay," she added.

189.title: 'Friends' creator gives $4mn to University due to guilt over show's lack of diversity
189.article_body: 'Friends' co-creator Marta Kauffman has said she's donating $4 million to Brandeis University after feeling "embarrassed" by and "guilty" over the sitcom's lack of diversity. Kauffman is donating the sum for an endowed professorship in the African and African American Studies Department. "It took me a long time to begin to understand how I internalised systemic racism," she said.

190.title: Ukrainian forces hit Russian military logistics base in Melitopol
190.article_body: Ukrainian forces struck a Russian military logistics base in Russia-occupied Melitopol on Sunday, the city's exiled mayor Ivan Fedorov said. "At 3 o'clock (0000 GMT) and 5 o'clock (0200 GMT), there were over 30 strikes on a single military base," Fedorov stated. A Russia-installed official confirmed the Ukrainian strikes but no information was provided regarding the target of the strikes.

191.title: KCR has no care for unemployment, only wants his son to be CM: Shah
191.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday said that Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao has no concern for the unemployed youth and only wants his son to be the CM of the state. Shah added he doesn't care about the people's source of livelihood, adding that the next term is reserved neither for his son nor him, but for BJP.

192.title: Telangana govt has become a symbol of corruption: Piyush Goyal
192.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Sunday said that the Telangana government has become a symbol of corruption, adding that the state's residents want a change. Goyal further stated that members from the same family hold key positions in the state government. His remarks came on the second day of the BJP's national executive meet, which was held in Secunderabad.

193.title: Will prove majority with 166 votes in tomorrow's floor test: Maha Deputy CM
193.article_body: Ahead of the newly-formed Maharashtra government's floor test in the Assembly on Monday, Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Sunday said, "We will prove our majority with 166 votes in tomorrow's vote of confidence." "The youngest Speaker candidate won the Speaker election with 164 votes today as 2 MLAs couldn't come due to health issues," Fadnavis added.

194.title: Kanye West sued for copyright infringement over sample on 'Flowers'
194.article_body: A copyright infringement lawsuit has been filed against rapper Kanye West for allegedly using a sample on his song 'Flowers' from his new album 'Donda 2'. Musician Marshall Jefferson has alleged that a sample from his 1986 song 'Move Your Body (House Music Anthem)' is "repeated at least 22 times throughout" 'Flowers' without gaining permission or providing compensation.

195.title: Death toll from landslide in Manipur's Noney reaches 42; 20 still missing
195.article_body: The death toll due to the landslide at Tupul railway station in Manipur's Noney increased to 42, after eight more bodies were recovered from under the debris during a search operation on Sunday. As per reports, the search operation may take a few more days. Around 20 persons are reportedly still missing.

196.title: Our fighter jets to guard Slovakia's airspace from Sept: Czech PM
196.article_body: Czech Republic's PM Petr Fiala said on Sunday that the country's fighter jets will begin guarding neighbouring Slovakia's airspace from September. The move comes after Slovakia requested its NATO allies to patrol its airspace as it decided to ground its Russian-made MiG-29 fighter jets. The MiG-29 fighter jets are likely to be sent to Ukraine amid the ongoing Russian invasion.

197.title: Centre to declare startup rankings of states on July 4
197.article_body: The results of the 3rd Ranking of States' on Support to Start-up Ecosystems will be released by Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Monday. Conducted by the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT), 24 states and 7 Union Territories participated in the exercise. The rankings encourage states, UTs to strengthen support to the startup ecosystem, the government stated.

198.title: World no. 66 Bouzkova reaches 1st Grand Slam quarters at Wimbledon
198.article_body: World number 66 Marie Bouzkova has reached her first Grand Slam quarter-final after beating France's Caroline Garcia 7-5, 6-2 in fourth round at Wimbledon on Sunday. "If you would tell me before the tournament started I'd be in the quarters, I probably wouldn't believe you," said Bouzkova. The 23-year-old Czech will next face either third-seeded Ons Jabeur or Elise Mertens.

199.title: Virat Kohli blows a kiss after taking catch to dismiss Bairstow, video goes viral
199.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli blew a kiss after taking a catch to dismiss Jonny Bairstow in England's first innings in the rescheduled fifth Test. Bairstow was dismissed on the bowling of Mohammad Shami. Bairstow scored 106 runs off 140 deliveries. Earlier in the innings, the duo were seen sledging each other.

200.title: Video shows truck powered by jet engines exploding while racing planes in US, 1 killed
200.article_body: The 40-year-old driver of a truck that was powered by jet engines was killed during a US airshow after the vehicle exploded. The accident was caught on video and it showed the vehicle catching on fire while racing two planes that were flying above it. Chris Darnell was killed while driving the truck at 300 miles (483 km) per hour.

201.title: Fan walked up my building's stairs to meet me, it was scary: Kiara
201.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani revealed that a fan once walked up all the stairs of her building to meet her, adding she lives on a very high floor. She said he wanted to tell her how much she means to him. "I was like...'Why? You could've just taken the lift...But don't come to my house next time, it's...scary also'," Kiara said.

202.title: Our approach is to dominate Sri Lanka Women in 2nd ODI: Vastrakar
202.article_body: India Women all-rounder Pooja Vastrakar said her side's approach is to dominate Sri Lanka Women in the second ODI in Pallekele. "We'll have our first game approach in the second match. And we would like to win the series 3-0," she added. The match will be played on Monday. India are leading the three-match series 1-0.

203.title: HDFC-HDFC Bank merger receives go-ahead from NSE and BSE
203.article_body: HDFC Bank and parent HDFC on Sunday said that they have received "no adverse observations" from BSE and "no objection" from the National Stock Exchange (NSE) for their merger. However, in separate regulatory filings, they noted that the proposed HDFC-HDFC Bank merger still requires approvals from the RBI, CCI and NCLT. The merger was announced in April this year.

204.title: Drake makes surprise appearance at Backstreet Boys' Toronto concert
204.article_body: Rapper Drake made a surprise appearance onstage during band Backstreet Boys' concert at the Budweiser stage in Canada's Toronto. A video which is going viral shows the band performing their 1999 song 'I Want It That Way' while Drake sings his 2013 song 'Hold On, We're Going Home' merged with it. Backstreet Boys is currently on their DNA World Tour.

205.title: I just hope the delivery is normal: Harsh Varrdhan on sister Sonam's pregnancy
205.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor's brother, actor Harsh Varrdhan, while talking to a news portal, revealed that he is excited about Sonam's pregnancy. "I am excited. Let’s just hope that the delivery is normal and Sonam is okay. Honestly speaking, I am not good with kids," he added. "It is a new experience for all of us," Harsh Varrdhan said.

206.title: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann likely to expand Cabinet on July 4
206.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann likely to induct five new ministers and expand the Cabinet on Monday, according to reports. The oath taking ceremony will take place in Raj Bhawan at 5 pm, reports quoted an official as saying. With this, the Punjab Cabinet will have 15 ministers, including the Chief Minister. This will be CM Mann's first Cabinet expansion.

207.title: WhatsApp working on feature to let users hide 'Online' status: Report
207.article_body: WhatsApp is reportedly working on a new feature that will allow users to hide their 'Online' status from specific contacts. Users will reportedly get to choose who can see when they are online by either selecting 'Everyone' or 'Same as Last Seen'. Notably, for 'Last Seen' status setting, users get four options: Everybody, My Contacts, My Contacts Except, and Nobody.

208.title: BJP will resolve all problems of Northeast by 2024: Amit Shah
208.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that BJP has found a permanent address to the issues in the Northeastern states. Speaking at the BJP national executive meet in Hyderabad, Shah said that all problems of the Northeast will be resolved by 2024 and the region will face no issues in the coming times.

209.title: Himachal Police holds constable exam for second time after paper leak
209.article_body: The constable recruitment exam for Himachal Police was held on Sunday, amid tight security, for the second time after a question paper leak led to the exam's cancellation in March. More than 75,000 candidates appeared for the examination this time. "There are flying squads, there are checking teams. We have frisking staff at every examination centre," said DIG Sumedha Dwivedi.

210.title: India gifts 75 ambulances and 17 school buses to Nepal
210.article_body: India on Sunday gifted 75 ambulances and 17 school buses to Nepal as part of its ongoing efforts to build on a "robust and longstanding" partnership between the two countries. The vehicles will be handed over to various governmental departments and NGOs working in healthcare and education sectors in various districts of Nepal, the Indian mission said.

211.title: NDRF deploys six teams in flood-prone districts of Gujarat
211.article_body: The NDRF on Sunday deployed six teams in various districts of Gujarat and placed them on standby to deal with possible floods caused by incessant rainfall in the state. Four teams have been sent to the Rajkot district and one each to the Surat and Banaskantha districts. In the Anand district, two people died after drowning in rainwater this week.

212.title: Only the best proposal from start-ups can attract funds: Mariwala
212.article_body: Marico Chairman Harsh Mariwala believes that corrections are happening in the start-up funding ecosystem. "With the funding environment tightened, now only the best proposal from start-ups can attract funds," he said. Mariwala further stated that funders are increasing time frames, but that it was justified because scaling of businesses and growth rate was also higher.

213.title: Taught me tremendous grace: Sushmita on winning Miss India & Miss Universe titles
213.article_body: Speaking about winning Miss India and Miss Universe titles, Sushmita Sen said, "Winning Miss Universe [was] making history for my country. One of the things that was ingrained while I left from here was, don't expect much, so that victory was a different victory altogether." "[It] taught me tremendous grace. It showed me generosity of spirit," she added.

214.title: IFS officer's video of cheetah climbing & sitting on tourist vehicle goes viral
214.article_body: Indian Forest Service (IFS) officer Surender Mehra shared a video of a cheetah climbing a tourist vehicle during a safari, which has gone viral on Twitter. The clip shows the animal climbing up onto the vehicle's spare wheel before reaching its roof and sitting down. "Man in wild," said Mehra while sharing the video.

215.title: Delhi L-G inspects drainage at waterlogged sites amid monsoons
215.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor Vinai Kumar Saxena inspected waterlogged sites such as Indraprastha-WHO stretch, Railway underpass at Pul Prahladpur and Minto Bridge. Officials were instructed to make drainage in these areas fool-proof. "The L-G instructed the officials to put in place a comprehensive plan consisting of long-term measures to deal with the problem of waterlogging," the L-G's office said.

216.title: Bairstow was playing like Pujara, Kohli unnecessarily made him Pant by sledging: Sehwag
216.article_body: Reacting to England's Jonny Bairstow's 106(140) against India in the rescheduled fifth Test, Virender Sehwag stated that Bairstow was playing like Cheteshwar Pujara, but Virat Kohli unnecessarily made him Rishabh Pant by sledging. Notably, Bairstow was batting on 13 runs from 61 deliveries before being sledged by Kohli. After the sledging, Bairstow made 93 runs off 79 balls.

217.title: IndiGo crew took mass leave on Air India recruitment day causing flight delays: Reports
217.article_body: A significant number of cabin crew members of IndiGo had taken sick leave on Saturday when Air India conducted its recruitment drive, reports said on Sunday. PTI reported that the staffers took leave from work and went for the recruitment drive. This came after DGCA took note of the massive delays in IndiGo flights reported on Saturday.

218.title: Banking frauds of over ₹100 crore decline by over 50% in FY22: Data
218.article_body: The number of banking sector frauds worth over ₹100 crore declined to 118 in FY22 from 265 in FY21, official data showed. As per data, banks reported cases worth ₹41,000 crore in FY22 compared to ₹1.05 lakh-crore last year. This comes as RBI carried out a study on the implementation of Early Warning System framework in select banks in 2021-22.

219.title: 70 illegal constructions demolished in Bihar's Patna using 20 bulldozers
219.article_body: The administration in Bihar's Patna on Sunday cleared 40 acres of land after demolishing 70 illegally constructed houses in Rajiv Nagar during a demolition drive carried out using 20 bulldozers. Over 12 people, who resisted the anti-encroachment drive, were arrested amid clashes with police. Patna SP, along with some other policemen, sustained injuries in clashes, DM Chandrashekhar Singh said.

220.title: 59,000 Tesla cars have faulty emergency call system: German authority
220.article_body: Germany's road traffic agency said it is recalling Tesla models Y and 3 over a software glitch that affects 59,129 Tesla vehicles globally. As per the agency, the glitch causes breakdown of the eCall, which is designed to automatically contact emergency responders in the event of serious accidents. This comes as Tesla reported an 18% decline in deliveries in Q2.

221.title: Egypt shuts down several beaches after woman dies in shark attack
221.article_body: Egypt's Red Sea Governorate has issued an order demanding closure of several Red Sea beaches following a 68-year-old Austrian woman's death in a shark attack off the coast of Sahl Hasheesh on Friday. The victim swam to the shore after being attacked on her arm and leg, witnesses said. She reportedly succumbed to her injuries in the ambulance.

222.title: Personal attack on judges lead to dangerous scenario: SC judge who heard Nupur's plea
222.article_body: Supreme Court judge Justice JB Pardiwala, who along with Justice Surya Kant heard Nupur Sharma's plea, criticised people for "personal attacks" on judges for their judgement. "Personal attacks on judges for their judgements lead to a dangerous scenario where judges have to think about what the media thinks instead of what the law really thinks," he stated.

223.title: Ex-Mumbai Police chief Sanjay Pandey summoned by ED in NSE co-location case
223.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned former Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey on July 5 in connection with a money laundering case related to the National Stock Exchange (NSE) co-location scam, an official said on Sunday. The summons was sent on Saturday to Pandey, who retired from the police force on June 30, the ED official added.

224.title: Amravati killing was portrayed as theft, will be probed: Fadnavis
224.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said on Sunday that the theft angle in the killing of a chemist in Amravati will be probed. "Accused...have been nabbed...NIA is investigating [the case to find]...if there's some international connection," he added. The victim, Umesh Kolhe, was murdered on June 21 over his online posts in support of suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma.

225.title: Vijay Deverakonda did a lot of posing routine for Liger's poster: Trainer
225.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda's trainer Kuldep Sethi said the actor was in good shape for Liger, but for the photoshoot, which they shot a year ago, he had to train a little extra. "We started training and I...changed a bit of his workout style... It was...tiring for him but with this routine, he also got to showcase his muscle," he added.

226.title: Lashkar terrorist caught in J&K was BJP IT cell member, had quit 2 months ago
226.article_body: One of the two Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorists who were caught by villagers in J&K's Reasi on Sunday was a BJP IT cell member. Talib Hussain had worked as Jammu BJP Minority Morcha's IT and social media in-charge. BJP Minority Morcha president Sheikh Bashir said Hussain was working with BJP for a "long time" and had resigned two months ago.

227.title: Messi is the best: Xavi on comparison between Ronaldo and Messi
227.article_body: Comparing Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi, Barcelona manager and former teammate of Messi, Xavi Hernandez said that Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) forward is the best in history, adding Messi does more things compared to the Manchester United forward. "Messi is the player that makes the most difference in the world. It's more than obvious," he added.

228.title: 2 men cheat Pune bank of ₹65 lakh by securing loan on forged docs
228.article_body: Two people allegedly cheated a private bank of ₹65 lakh by procuring loans using forged documents, reports said. In his complaint, the bank manager said that the accused used forged ITR documents and manipulated bank statements to apply for the loan. According to police sub-inspector S Girnar, one of the accused is associated with three more bank loan fraud cases.

229.title: 9-year-old boy dies as part of balcony collapses in Delhi's Rohini
229.article_body: A nine-year-old boy died after a portion of the balcony of an old house collapsed in the Begum Vihar area of Delhi's Rohini, police said. According to Rohini DCP Pranav Tayal, the boy was playing in front of the house when the incident took place. He was taken to a hospital, where he succumbed to his injuries, the DCP added.

230.title: Siblings impersonate beggars to commit theft, arrested in Mumbai
230.article_body: Mumbai Police have arrested three people who pretended to be beggars and stole from multiple households, reports have stated. The accused, identified as Satyababa (40), Nisha (22) and Pooja (25), are siblings who hail from Maharashtra's Ahmednagar and had travelled to Mumbai along with a child with an intent to commit theft. They have been placed under judicial custody.

231.title: Rahul Gandhi stops car, helps man injured in road accident in Kerala; video surfaces
231.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi recently helped a man injured in road accident in Kerala's Wayanad, a video of which has surfaced online. Rahul stopped his car on seeing the injured man and helped in taking him to a hospital in his convoy's ambulance. The video shows him helping with the stretcher while the man was being taken to the ambulance.

232.title: BJP govt in K'taka trying to communalise school curriculum: Sinha
232.article_body: The opposition candidate for the Presidential polls, Yashwant Sinha, on Sunday said that the BJP government in Karnataka was attempting to communalise the school curriculum in the state. He accused the Central government of launching repeated assaults on democracy and secularism. He added that the Centre has "unleashed poisonous communal propaganda to divide India's multi-religious society".

233.title: Johnny Depp gets tattoo of broken arrow post defamation case win
233.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp got a tattoo of a broken arrow on his underwrist a month after winning the defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard. The process reportedly took six hours. As per reports, a broken arrow signifies "a new start and new hope" after "burying the battle ax". Pictures and videos of Depp getting the tattoo are going viral.

234.title: BJP MP asks Raj CM to get mental treatment after nikamma remark for Minister
234.article_body: BJP MP Ashok Bajpai took a jibe at Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot for calling Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat "nikamma", saying that the CM should get mental treatment. He added that the CM's old age is visible in his conduct, adding that Shekhawat has worked hard to provide tap water in a short period of time.

235.title: Russia claims full control of Ukraine's Luhansk region as its last city falls
235.article_body: Russia on Sunday said it has taken control of eastern Ukraine's Luhansk region after the fall of the region's last Ukrainian holdout. The city of Lysychansk, which was a key Ukrainian city, and some nearby settlements fell under the control of Russian forces on Sunday, Russia claimed. Ukraine is, however, yet to comment on Russian claims.

236.title: 22-yr-old law student killed, his body thrown in UP drain; police probe role of gay app
236.article_body: Yash Rastogi, a 22-year-old law student, was killed and his body was thrown in a drain in gunny bag in UP's Meerut, police said. Three accused, reportedly identified as Shavej, Imran and Salman, have been arrested. Police are investigating the role of a gay app they were associated with amid reports that Yash blackmailed the accused with their objectionable video.

237.title: 200 families left homeless in Assam's Barpeta as river wipes out houses
237.article_body: Over 200 families in the Kachumara area of Assam's Barpeta district have been forced to move to other safer places after the Brahmaputra river wiped out their houses and several bighas of land. "Many roads of this area are also damaged due to river erosion," a local resident said. So far, at least 174 have died in Assam amid floods.

238.title: B'wood is playing safe by remaking films & not creating original content: Neil
238.article_body: Actor Neil Nitin Mukesh said that Bollywood tries to ‘play it safe’ by remaking films and not creating original content. "There are various sub-genres, like psychological thrillers, political thrillers, horror thrillers and so on. Why aren’t we exploring those?" he added. "We are still remaking films instead of coming up with original ideas and content," Neil said.

239.title: Akhilesh like Mughal emperors who oppressed kin for power: BJP MP
239.article_body: BJP MP Dinesh Lal Yadav on Sunday likened SP chief Akhilesh Yadav to the Mughal emperors, who he said oppressed their kin for the sake of power. "Reawakened Muslim and Yadav voters after 2014 have shattered the hope of the SP, which used to claim a monopoly over them," he said. SP is turning into a "samaptwadi party," he added.

240.title: AAP expanding in Guj, people tired of 27 yrs of BJP: Kejriwal
240.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said that AAP is expanding on a huge scale in Gujarat, adding that the people of the state are tired of 27 years of the BJP. "BJP thinks Congress can't replace them, so they've developed ego. People are looking with hope towards AAP this time," he said.

241.title: BJP govt's policy is Gandhi in abroad & Godse in India: Yechury
241.article_body: CPI(M)'s Sitaram Yechury has criticised Centre for dismissing a US panel's recent report on religious freedom in India. "Policy of BJP government is Gandhi in abroad and Godse in...[India]...On one hand, [they] want to tell everyone that we have...democracy...and on the other, they're crushing...democratic rights inside [India]," he said. Panel had termed India a "country of particular concern".

242.title: Was confused about my tactics: Top seed Swiatek on 3rd round Wimbledon loss
242.article_body: Commenting on her third round loss against unseeded Alize Cornet at Wimbledon, world number one Iga Swiatek, who was on a 37-match winning streak, said she was confused about her tactics. "What can I say? I know I didn't play good tennis," she added. The top seed hit 33 unforced errors to Cornet's seven in the 6-4, 6-2 defeat.

243.title: Heavy rainfall causes waterlogging, disrupts traffic in several parts of Delhi
243.article_body: Heavy rainfall lashed parts of Delhi, leading to traffic disruption and waterlogging in many parts on Sunday, as part of an ongoing wet spell with the onset of monsoon. Areas like Mandi House, Tilak Marg and Pragati Maidan were reportedly flooded after the rainfall. Delhi had received heavy rainfall on Thursday, which brought the temperature below 30 degrees Celsius.

244.title: Debina Bonnerjee, Gurmeet Choudhary share first pic of daughter
244.article_body: Television actors Debina Bonnerjee and Gurmeet Choudhary shared the first picture of their baby girl on social media on Sunday. The couple can be seen kissing their daughter's cheeks as she looks into the camera. Debina wrote, "Introducing Lianna. Our heart united into one." Lianna is Debina and Gurmeet's first child together and was born on April 3.

245.title: Tiger Shroff shares throwback training video, says 'The struggle was real'
245.article_body: Tiger Shroff, taking to Instagram, shared a throwback video from his acrobatics training session. "Man the struggle and grind [were] real! Found some old training footage of little me with not so little dreams and my quest to become...action hero," he wrote. Actor Bhakhtyar Irani reacted to the video, writing, "When he was a cub...looked dangerous to kill even then."

246.title: We don't make family entertainers due to influence by the West: Varun
246.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan stated in an interview that Bollywood has stopped making big-scale masala family entertainers because it is too influenced by the West. "No one knows what type of films will work, from the biggest producers to trade people," he added. The actor further said that after COVID-19, one has to do "what your conviction says".

247.title: Ronaldo wants to leave Man Utd; doesn't feel ambition: Italian journalist
247.article_body: Italian transfer journalist Fabrizio Romano has claimed that Manchester United footballer Cristiano Ronaldo wants to leave the English football club. "Ronaldo told Manchester United [that] he wants to leave this summer as he wants to see more ambition," Romano tweeted. He added that the 37-year-old footballer likes the club and its manager but doesn't feel the ambition.

248.title: I can hurt him on grass court: Nadal's next opponent Botic on their match
248.article_body: World number four Rafael Nadal's next opponent at Wimbledon Botic van de Zandschulp has said he can defeat the two-time Wimbledon champion on the grass court in their fourth-round match. "The biggest challenge in tennis is to play Nadal at French Open...but [I've] more confidence here to really make a shot...I can hurt him on the grass court," stated Zandschulp.

249.title: Media loves to write that I'm bad for tennis but clearly not: Kyrgios
249.article_body: Talking about his third round win against fourth seed Stefanos Tsitsipas at Wimbledon, unseeded Australian Nick Kyrgios said, "Hell of an atmosphere and an amazing match. I honestly felt like the favourite coming [into this match]." He added, "Everywhere I go I seem to be having full stadiums...media loves to write that I'm bad for the sport but clearly not."

250.title: 4 killed, 3 injured as cylinder explodes during Punjab wedding function
250.article_body: Four persons, including three women and one girl, were killed and three sustained injuries after a cylinder exploded during a wedding function in Punjab's Fazilka district. The explosion was caused due to a leak in the regulator of a gas cylinder, according to police. The injured persons are undergoing treatment at a hospital, police added.

251.title: 10-year-old rape victim denied abortion in US' Ohio after SC ends abortion rights
251.article_body: A 10-year-old rape victim was denied an abortion in Ohio after the Supreme Court of the US overturned the Roe vs Wade decision last month. A child abuse doctor in Ohio contacted an obstetrician-gynecologist in Indiana, after receiving the girl who was six weeks and three days pregnant. She is now travelling to Indiana for an abortion, the Hill reported.

252.title: 'Pushpa' composer DSP, Honey Singh team up for Salman's Bhaijaan: Reports
252.article_body: Music composer Devi Sri Prasad aka DSP, who composed music for Allu Arjun starrer 'Pushpa: The Rise', and rapper Honey Singh have reportedly teamed up for a peppy number in Salman Khan's 'Bhaijaan'. "The makers have already recorded the song, and some who have heard it insist that it would be an earworm for the audiences," reports stated.

253.title: Can't believe England haven't learnt from their mistakes: Vaughan
253.article_body: Former England skipper Michael Vaughan has criticised the English team for repeating mistakes that "happened at Lord's" Test in 2021. "You've got Stuart Broad and James Anderson...bowling to Jasprit Bumrah...They decide to go short with the field spread out...Can't believe they haven't learnt," Vaughan said. Notably, Broad went for 35 runs in an over against Bumrah at Edgbaston on Saturday.

254.title: Old is gold, a match-winner: Sehwag to Harbhajan on his 42nd birthday
254.article_body: Virender Sehwag took to Twitter to wish Harbhajan Singh on his 42nd birthday on Sunday and wrote, "Old is gold, wishing a match-winner and a guy who tries to keep the atmosphere jovial everywhere he goes." Gautam Gambhir tweeted, "Happy Birthday Bhajji pa! You may be done with bowling, but you can never be done with entertaining! Keep shining brother."

255.title: Virat Kohli sledges Jonny Bairstow, makes fun of him; video goes viral
255.article_body: Ex-Team India captain Virat Kohli was seen indulging in a verbal argument with England's Jonny Bairstow during the third day of the rescheduled fifth Test at Edgbaston. In a video that has gone viral, Kohli was heard saying, "Little bit faster than Southee...eh?" While, in another video, he was seen making fun of Bairstow after he missed a delivery.

256.title: IndiGo flights hit by delays across India over staff shortage, DGCA seeks clarification
256.article_body: IndiGo flight operations have been hit with massive delays across India due to the non-availability of crew members, reports said on Sunday. Aviation regulator DGCA has taken cognisance of the issue and sought a clarification/explanation from the airline, ANI reported citing DGCA officials. As many as 900 IndiGo flights have been affected due to staff shortage, ET Now reported.

257.title: India coach job for me was to prove media wrong: Shastri
257.article_body: Former India head coach Ravi Shastri has said that his coaching job with the Indian team for him was to prove the "media wrong". "The last thing I was worried about was media...The fact was that we were bullies at home and we didn't play great [overseas]. So my job...was to prove media wrong," Shastri said.

258.title: Incoming deliveries were bowled as part of strategy against Root: Zaheer
258.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Zaheer Khan praised Indian pacers for planning England batter Joe Root's wicket on Day 2 of their ongoing rescheduled Test. "Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammad Shami had a discussion...After that, incoming deliveries were bowled as part of the strategy," stated Zaheer. Mohammed Siraj dismissed Root for 31 with an incoming delivery that had some extra bounce.

259.title: Terrorism is raging because of Congress party: Shivraj Singh Chouhan
259.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Sunday said that terrorism is raging because of the Congress party. "In Udaipur, there was recently a killing in broad daylight. We will crush terrorism. We will run bulldozers over the miscreants," Chouhan added. Furthermore, Chouhan said that Congress is a party of "polarisation" and the country lost its respect under their rule.

260.title: PM Modi, Shah’s decision to make me CM opened eyes of many: Eknath Shinde
260.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Sunday said that the decision of PM Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah to make him the Chief Minister despite having more members than his side "has opened the eyes of many". "Everyone knows that Devendra Fadnavis had 115 members with him. I had only 50," he added.

261.title: What I saw was bizarre, something I never imagined: Shastri on Bumrah's world record
261.article_body: Talking about Jasprit Bumrah breaking the world record for scoring most runs in an over in Tests, ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said, "What I saw was bizarre." He added, "It’s something I’ve never imagined. The world record, from Bumrah, batting at number 10, as captain of India, for the first time." Bumrah scored 29 runs off Stuart Broad's over.

262.title: Twitter CEO takes coffee orders from staff during visit to UK office, pics surface
262.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal visited the company's office in the United Kingdom last week for a series of events. Employees took to Twitter to share photos of Agrawal taking coffee orders while another top Twitter executive, CFO Ned Segal served cookies along with it to the staff. The Managing Director of Twitter UK could also be seen with Agrawal.

263.title: Paris airport workers warn of another walkout from July 8 to 10
263.article_body: Paris airport workers, who have staged a series of strikes demanding higher salaries, have warned of another walkout from July 8-10, which can cause disruption for travellers. Earlier, airport operator ADP offered a 4% pay hike to the staff if they ended the ongoing strike. However, the workers rejected it saying it was not good enough.

264.title: Will test bullet that killed Al Jazeera reporter in West Bank: Israel
264.article_body: Israel said on Sunday that it'll test the bullet that killed a Palestinian-American journalist in May to determine whether one of its soldiers shot her. This comes after Palestine handed over the bullet to US experts after being reassured that Israel won't participate in ballistics test. The victim, Shireen Abu Akleh, was killed while covering a raid in West Bank.

265.title: Adele stops London concert midway to help fans, video viral
265.article_body: British singer Adele, who recently performed at London's BST Hyde Park Festival, stopped her performance four times to help fans. A viral video shows the singer asking the band to stop, walking to the front of the stage and directing security to the fans who needed help. This comes after 10 fans died during Travis Scott's Astroworld Festival in November.

266.title: Broad will always remember two names: Aakash on 35-run over in 5th Test
266.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said England's Stuart Broad will always remember two Indian players, Yuvraj Singh and Jasprit Bumrah. "Broad has created records which he won't be very proud of," added Chopra. Bumrah smashed Broad for the most expensive over in Test cricket history in the ongoing fifth Test, while Yuvraj had smashed him for six consecutive sixes in 2007.

267.title: Rebel MLAs were unable to look us in the eye: Aaditya Thackeray
267.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray on Sunday said that rebel MLAs, who returned to Mumbai from Goa, were unable to look Shiv Sena in the eye. "How long are you going to move from one hotel to the other? These MLAs will have to go to their Assembly constituencies one day. How will they face the people then?" he asked.

268.title: New York bans guns in many public places after Supreme Court order
268.article_body: The US' New York state has banned carrying guns in several public places, including Times Square. Under the new law, gun-licence seekers will be required to prove their shooting skills and submit their social media accounts for review by the government. This comes days after the US Supreme Court ruled against New York's restrictive gun-licence laws.

269.title: Next 30-40 years to be era of BJP: Union Home Minister Amit Shah
269.article_body: Union Home Minister and BJP leader Amit Shah said that the next 30-40 years will be the era of his party and India will become a “vishwa guru” (world leader). Furthermore, Shah, during the BJP's national executive meeting, said “dynastic politics, casteism and politics of appeasement” were the “greatest sins” and the reasons behind the country’s sufferings over the years.

270.title: Delhi Police bust fake call centre cheating US citizens, 12 held
270.article_body: Delhi Police busted a fake call centre involved in cheating US citizens on the pretext of redeeming gift cards and arrested 12 people. "On pointing out of informer a raid was conducted and it was found that a setup of computers and accessories were installed in the premises," said a police release. They presented themselves as Amazon representatives, it added.

271.title: Israel shoots down 3 Hezbollah drones heading towards gas field
271.article_body: The Israeli military said on Saturday that it had shot down three drones launched by the militant group Hezbollah. The Iran-backed Shi'ite group said in a statement that it had launched the unarmed drones towards the "disputed" Karish gas field for reconnaissance missions. "The message was delivered," Hezbollah added. One drone was intercepted by an Israeli fighter jet, AFP reported.

272.title: New sleeping pod hotel opens at Mumbai's CSMT station, pics released
272.article_body: Union Minister of Railways Ashwini Vaishnaw on Sunday shared photos of the newly-opened sleeping pod hotel at Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT) in Mumbai. This is the second such facility of the Indian Railways in Mumbai. The new hotel is expected to have a capacity of 50 people along with amenities like key card access, air conditioning, and CCTV surveillance.

273.title: Robbers steal computers from Odisha school, scrawl 'Dhoom 4' on blackboard
273.article_body: Miscreants robbed computers and other electronic items from a high school in Odisha's Nabarangpur district and scrawled phrases like "Dhoom 4", "we will return" and "coming soon" on a blackboard. 'Dhoom 4' is an upcoming Bollywood film, featuring police and thieves. The thieves also allegedly wrote "catch us if you can" in Odia on the blackboard.

274.title: The track was brought to me as a joke: Ishq Bector on Aye Hip Hopper
274.article_body: Rapper-music composer Ishq Bector, speaking about his song 'Aye Hip Hopper', said, "The track came together when Hanif Shaikh brought it to me as a joke about a star hip-hopper and a romantic angle with his maid." "But then it...kind of snowballed," he said, adding, "I presented...demo to Sunidhi Chauhan and she nearly fell off...chair laughing...and agreed to sing [it]."

275.title: Accepting Deputy CM post must be a 'real shocker' for Fadnavis: Shiv Sena
275.article_body: In an editorial of its mouthpiece 'Saamana', Shiv Sena has said that accepting the Deputy CM post must have been a "real shocker" for BJP's Devendra Fadnavis. "...The climax at the Raj Bhavan was the most shocking part...Fadnavis accepted the [Deputy CM] post as the party leadership's order. But now being said...that Fadnavis showed a big heart," the editorial said.

276.title: Tribal woman set ablaze over land dispute in MP, 2 arrested
276.article_body: A tribal woman suffered severe burn injuries after three people set her ablaze over a land dispute in MP's Guna district, police said on Sunday. A video, purportedly shot by the accused, surfaced online, wherein the charred woman was seen crying in pain, with smoke all around her. The police arrested two of the three accused.

277.title: List of state-wise active COVID-19 cases released
277.article_body: The Health Ministry on Sunday stated that there are 1,11,711 active COVID-19 cases in the country, with Kerala accounting for the highest number of active cases at 29,505. This is followed by Maharashtra (23,447), Tamil Nadu (13,319), West Bengal (9,290), Karnataka (6,440), Telangana (4,784), Gujarat (3,478), Delhi (3,410) and Uttar Pradesh (3,029).

278.title: Great taste my friend: Priyanka to kid who said he 'loves her' in TikTok video
278.article_body: Priyanka Chopra has reacted to a TikTok video where a child could be seen calling her pretty and saying he loves her. She shared the video on her Instagram Stories, writing, "Great taste my friend." The child was reacting to Priyanka's old picture from a 2017 article about her being declared the world's second most beautiful woman after a poll.

279.title: M-cap of 3 of top 10 most valued firms decline by ₹73,630 crore in past week
279.article_body: The market valuation of three of the 10 most valued domestic firms declined by ₹73,630.56 crore in past week. While Reliance Industries took the biggest hit and saw its valuation dipping by ₹62,100.95 crore to reach ₹16,29,684.50 crore. It was followed by ICICI Bank and HUL whose valuation dropped by ₹6,654.2 crore and ₹4,875.41 crore, respectively.

280.title: Is Bihar Police so incompetent?: Tejashwi after BJP tightens office security
280.article_body: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav criticised BJP for increasing security in its party offices in Bihar amid protests against Agnipath scheme and said that they don't have faith in their own "double engine government". "The Bihar government should tell us whether the police is so incompetent so as to warrant deployment of central forces at BJP offices?" asked Yadav.

281.title: 19 dead after bus falls into ravine in Pakistan amid heavy rains
281.article_body: At least 19 people were killed and several others were left injured after a bus veered off a mountainous road amid heavy rains and fell into a ravine in Pakistan's Balochistan province on Sunday. The bus, which was reportedly carrying 30 passengers, was headed from Islamabad towards Quetta. The injured persons have been admitted to hospital, an official said.

282.title: Gadkari shares pics of new 4-lane Goa-Karnataka coastal highway, calls it 'magnificent'
282.article_body: Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari shared pictures of the new four-lane Goa-Karnataka coastal highway on Twitter. "Magnificent due to its scenic view...this project is an important coastal highway link between west and south India," Gadkari stated. Gadkari added the four-laning of the highway is nearing completion, with 92.42% work already completed. He added the traffic is open on highway.

283.title: 27 missing as ship breaks in half amid typhoon in South China Sea, video surfaces
283.article_body: As many as 27 people are missing and feared dead as a massive ship broke into half and sank amid typhoon Chaba in the South China Sea. A video of the rescue has been released by the Hong Kong Government Flying Service and it shows some crew members being airlifted. The footage shows the offshore vessel partially submerged.

284.title: Kartik is the same person he was before Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2's success: Kriti
284.article_body: Kartik Aaryan on Saturday shared a video with Kriti Sanon. In the video, the two were promoting his film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. When asked if Kartik is the same guy he was before the success of the film, Kriti said Kartik continues to be the same person she knew before. "We don’t let him fly too high," Kriti jokingly added.

285.title: Varun Dhawan, Kiara Advani's 'JugJugg Jeeyo' earns ₹100 cr worldwide
285.article_body: Director Raj Mehta's 'JugJugg Jeeyo', which features Varun Dhawan, Kiara Advani, Anil Kapoor and Neetu Kapoor, has earned over ₹100 crore worldwide. The actors took to their respective social media handles to thank fans. As per trade analyst Taran Adarsh, the film has crossed ₹61.44 crore at the Indian box office and is likely to cross ₹65 crore on Sunday.

286.title: 2 boys drown while swimming in artificial farm reservoir in Pune
286.article_body: Two boys, aged 13 and 14, drowned while swimming in an artificial farm reservoir in Pune's Dhayari area on Sunday. A third boy, who didn't get into the reservoir as he didn't know swimming, raised an alarm and called locals for help, a fire officer said. The bodies of the two deceased were recovered, the fire officer added.

287.title: PMC to buy additional saplings worth ₹45 lakh for plantation drive
287.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) will purchase additional saplings worth ₹45 lakh for its planned tree plantation drive to increase the green cover in the city, according to officials. PMC Garden Department chief Ashok Ghorpade said that the drive was affected due to the delay in monsoons. "We have saplings at various nurseries, but we'll...purchase additional saplings," he added.

288.title: He is outstanding, a class act: Vaughan after Jadeja's 104-run innings
288.article_body: Former England captain Michael Vaughan has praised India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja for his 104-run innings against England in the ongoing rescheduled Test. "He's a class act. I was looking at his numbers over the last 20-odd Test matches. He's averaging 48, only second to Rohit Sharma," stated Vaughan. Jadeja's hundred helped India post 416 in the first innings.

289.title: 'Jai Jai KCR' balloons spotted near PM's meet venue in Secunderabad
289.article_body: Ahead of PM Narendra Modi's public meeting in Secunderabad's Parade Grounds on Sunday, 'Jai Jai KCR' balloons were spotted outside the venue. A video of the balloons has also surfaced online. This comes as political banners and posters, including a few inspired by the show 'Money Heist', among others, surfaced across various locations in Hyderabad recently.

290.title: Delhi govt gives 10-day grace period to comply with single-use plastic ban
290.article_body: The Delhi government has decided to be lenient towards those violating the ban on single-use plastic (SUP) items for the initial 10 days. It has launched a campaign to create awareness against the use of such commodities and promote their alternatives. The AAP-led government will also provide incentives to SUP manufacturing units willing to switch over to green alternatives.

291.title: 25-year-old Black man shot 60 times by police in US: Lawyer who watched bodycam footage
291.article_body: A 25-year-old Black man named Jayland Walker was shot over 60 times by police in Ohio after a pursuit over a traffic violation, the lawyer who watched body camera footage of the incident said. The footage will be released to the public on Sunday. The officers involved have been placed on administrative leave during an investigation, the department's statement said.

292.title: Even Kasab didn’t have so much security: Aaditya on protection for rebel Sena MLAs
292.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray reacted to security arrangements for rebel Shiv Sena MLAs and said that even terrorist Ajmal Kasab did not have such security. "We have not seen such security before in Mumbai. Why are you scared? Is someone going to run away?" Thackeray said. The rebel Shiv Sena MLAs reached Vidhan Bhavan in special buses today.

293.title: Italy's Venice becomes world's 1st city to announce entry fee for tourists
293.article_body: Italy's Venice has become the world's first city to announce an entry fee for tourists as it tries to tackle the problem of crowding and "overtourism". The city will charge a €3-€10 (₹247-₹823) entry fee from tourists starting January 16, 2023. Visitors will also have to make an online booking before travelling to Venice next year.

294.title: Rihanna makes first appearance in London after welcoming son
294.article_body: Singer Rihanna made her first public appearance after welcoming her baby boy with rapper A$AP Rocky at the Wireless Festival in London. A$AP Rocky was among the performers at the festival. Rihanna was seen in an all-black ensemble that included a puffer jacket with feathers all around the hoodie and black pants. The couple welcomed their son on May 13.

295.title: BJP made clear democracy is for sale: KC Venugopal on Maha political development
295.article_body: Following the political development in Maharashtra, Congress leader KC Venugopal said that BJP has made it clear that the democracy is for sale. "Anybody can come, take money and they get to join the BJP. This is the fate of democracy in India but the people of India will fight it," Venugopal added.

296.title: I hang my head in 'shame': Kapil Sibal on state of judiciary
296.article_body: Rajya Sabha MP Kapil Sibal on Sunday expressed concern over the current state of the judiciary, saying that some members of the institution have let us down, adding that he hangs his head in shame. Responding to the arrest of Mohammed Zubair, Sibal said it is "unthinkable" for a person to get arrested for a tweet from four years ago.

297.title: Viral video shows Swiggy delivery boy riding a horse to deliver order amid Mumbai rains
297.article_body: A video of a Swiggy delivery agent riding a horse to deliver an order amid heavy rainfall in Mumbai has gone viral on social media. Several people took to social media to praise the delivery agent for his dedication, with one user saying, "Now this is what I call 'Shahi delivery'." "Something rare to find," said another user.

298.title: Got the tag of Queen of Punjabi films because of Ravii's manifestation: Sargun
298.article_body: Actress Sargun Mehta, who was seen in 'Saunkan Saunkne', spoke about her husband Ravii Dubey's role in her success. "I manifested coming in...Punjabi industry with my dreams, but if there’s ever a tag of Queen [of Punjabi films] attached to me, that’ll be Ravii’s manifestation," she said. "Since the time we've been together, that's all he's told me," she added.

299.title: Belarus claims to have intercepted missiles from Ukraine
299.article_body: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko claimed that the country intercepted missiles launched by Ukrainian forces a few days ago. Belarus did not want war with Ukraine, but would fight if its territory was invaded, Lukashenko said, according to state media. "They are provoking us…An attempt to strike military facilities on Belarusian territory was made from the territory of Ukraine," he said.

300.title: Mahesh Babu praises Haasan's 'Vikram', calls it 'new-age cult classic'
300.article_body: Actor Mahesh Babu took to Twitter to pen a note praising Kamal Haasan's recently released movie 'Vikram'. Calling it a "new-age cult classic", he wrote, "Lokesh Kanagaraj (director), would love to catch up with you and discuss the entire process of Vikram." He also praised the performances of actors Vijay Sethupathi, Fahadh Faasil and Kamal Haasan.

301.title: We're in Wimbledon for a stroll: Venus to reporter asking 'are you in it to win it'
301.article_body: During a press conference at Wimbledon 2022, Venus Williams, who's playing the mixed doubles event alongside Jamie Murray, was asked if the two were "in it to win it" or "for the experience" at the tournament. Jamie Murray responded with a smile saying, "We're better than that, come on." Venus replied sarcastically saying, "We're in it for a stroll."

302.title: Man arrested for killing homeless man in hit-and-run case in Delhi
302.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly killing a homeless man in a hit-and-run accident in Delhi's Outer district. The accused, identified as Ashok (31), allegedly crushed the victim's head after a tyre of the generator, which was attached to his car, ran over the victim, the Mangolpuri Police said. Notably, the unidentified deceased lived on footpaths, police added.

303.title: Man climbs wall, enters CM Mamata's residence in Kolkata late at night; arrested
303.article_body: A massive security breach took place at the residence of West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee in Kolkata's Kalighat on Saturday late night, after a man allegedly entered its premises by crossing over a wall. The man remained on the premises throughout the night and was arrested by police personnel, who spotted him on Sunday morning, officers said.

304.title: Amber calls $10mn awarded to Johnny 'excessive' in new appeal to dismiss verdict
304.article_body: Amber Heard has filed a fresh court appeal to either dismiss the June defamation trial verdict won by her ex-husband Johnny Depp, or start a new trial. The filing called the $10.35 million awarded to Depp "excessive", saying there was "no evidence" to substantiate it. She also cited 'poor legal reasoning' and 'improperly vetted jury' as reasons for verdict's dismissal.

305.title: Jadeja reminds Anderson of 2014 spat after 'He can bat like a proper batter now' remark
305.article_body: Team India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja reacted to England fast bowler James Anderson's remark that he can now bat like a proper batter following his century in the Edgbaston Test. "It's nice Jimmy Anderson has realised that after 2014...so I'm happy," Jadeja said. Notably, Anderson had allegedly abused and pushed Jadeja during the first Test at Trent Bridge in 2014.

306.title: Activists, Oppn protest new Maha govt's car shed plan in Mumbai's Aarey
306.article_body: Climate activists and the Opposition called for a peaceful protest at Mumbai's Aarey forest on Sunday morning, following which hundreds of citizens gathered at the spot. This comes after the newly-formed state government's decision to relocate Metro 3 car shed to Aarey Milk colony. "I humbly urge the new government to reconsider its decision," former minister Aaditya Thackeray tweeted.

307.title: Milind makes music video comeback after 25 yrs, says 'It was super fun'
307.article_body: Actor-model Milind Soman has made a comeback in a music video titled 'Shringaar'. Sharing his experience, Milind said it was "super fun" to do a music video after 25 years. "When 'Shringaar' came my way, I instantly loved...[it] and wanted to be...part of it," he added. Composed by Vayu, the song has been sung by Akasa, Aastha Gill and Raftaar.

308.title: BJP-Sena govt has taken charge, based on beliefs of Balasaheb Thackeray: Shinde
308.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Sunday said that the BJP-Shiv Sena government has taken charge, based on the beliefs of Balasaheb Thackeray. "I myself was a minister, several other ministers too left the government. This was a huge thing for a common worker like me who was devoted to the ideology of Balasaheb Thackeray and Anand Dighe," he added.

309.title: Headmaster accused of secretly filming female teachers hits them with stones in UP
309.article_body: A headmaster in UP's Bareilly has been suspended after a video of him attacking female teachers with stones went viral on social media. Khurshid Ali has been accused of secretly filming teachers, who he claims were working on their laptops rather than teaching children. Police said that a probe has been initiated against Ali in connection with the incident.

310.title: Punjab National Bank hikes FD interest rates on selected tenors from July 4
310.article_body: Punjab National Bank has increased interest rates on fixed deposits below ₹2 crore. Effective from July 4, it has increased rates on deposits with a maturity of 1-2 years and up to 3 years by 10 to 20 basis points. Deposits of 1-2 years will fetch a 5.30% interest rate, up by 10 basis points from 5.20%.

311.title: Always put Aus cricket in front; IPL, BBL taken backseat: Starc
311.article_body: Australian pacer Mitchell Starc has said that he always puts Australian cricket "in front" and for that, IPL and BBL have taken a "backseat". "I will always keep Australian cricket...and then franchise cricket...I have looked at the Australian schedule and want to be as fit and well-performed for that," Starc said after opting out of the upcoming BBL season.

312.title: We've often seen a partnership after England's 5th wicket falls: Jaffer
312.article_body: After England ended Day 2 of fifth Test against India at 84/5 in Edgbaston, Wasim Jaffer said a partnership has often been seen following the fall of hosts' fifth wicket. "India will have to stop that in...morning. This partnership between Jonny Bairstow and Ben Stokes is very important. If these wickets fall quickly, India will be in control," he added.

313.title: 3 Hyd metro stations to be closed during PM Modi's public meeting
313.article_body: Ahead of PM Narendra Modi's public meeting in Secunderabad on Sunday, metro stations of Paradise, Parade Grounds and JBS will be closed between 5:30 pm and 8 pm. Trains won't halt at these stations during this duration amid security concerns, Hyderabad Metro Rail Limited announced. Trains plying on Corridor 2 will ply between Secunderabad West and MGBS during this time.

314.title: Kohli might be praying for such clarity: Manjrekar on Jadeja's knock vs Eng
314.article_body: Commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has said Virat Kohli might be praying to have the same clarity that Ravindra Jadeja had in his 104-run innings against England in the ongoing Test. "Jadeja was leaving the balls even slightly outside the off-stump, was playing them when it was close to off-stump and driving the pitched-up deliveries," explained Manjrekar. Kohli got out for 11(19).

315.title: Lower Byrasandra lake restoration to be over by next month: BBMP official
315.article_body: Restoration work being carried out at Bengaluru's Lower Byrasandra lake, also known as the Kelagina Kere, will get over by the next month, a BBMP executive engineer (lakes department) said. The civic body started the restoration work last year. An activist said that BBMP should also "concentrate" on Upper Byrasandra lake, which is about 200 metre from Lower Byrasandra lake.

316.title: Man promises to sell gold at inexpensive price, cheats 20 persons of ₹75 lakh in MP
316.article_body: A man from West Bengal allegedly cheated over 20 persons in MP on promise of selling them gold at an inexpensive price. The accused collected over ₹75 lakh from the victims, according to police. He had an office, that remains closed now, in MP Nagar from where he ran his business. According to police, efforts are underway to nab him.

317.title: China renews yellow alert as rainstorms hit some regions
317.article_body: China renewed a yellow alert on Sunday as severe rainstorms struck some parts of the country. The weather department has predicted rainstorms in parts of Guangdong, Guangxi, Hunan and Hubei regions. It has advised local governments to prepare for the heavy downpour and to check the drainage systems. It has also suggested authorities to take appropriate traffic control measures.

318.title: Akhilesh dissolves all SP executive units, except party's UP chief post
318.article_body: Samajwadi Party (SP) chief Akhilesh Yadav has dissolved all of the party's national, state and district executive bodies, except its Uttar Pradesh President post, with immediate effect. "National presidents, state presidents, district presidents of all...party's organisations, including youth and women's wings, have also been dissolved," SP tweeted. However, SP didn't give any reason for the move.

319.title: Only our party can free Delhi from BJP's garbage mountains: AAP MLA
319.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party's MLA and MCD in-charge Durgesh Pathak urged Delhi Governor to conduct Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) elections immediately and said that only AAP party can bring freedom from the "BJP’s garbage mountains" in the national capital. "From whichever side one enters Delhi...you are welcomed by the BJP's heaps of trash that are scattered all over," Pathak said.

320.title: Real face of democracy under BJP: Khalsa Aid Founder on his Twitter account ban
320.article_body: Khalsa Aid Founder Ravi Singh criticised the central government after his Twitter account was banned in India on Saturday. Sharing a picture of the account on Facebook, Singh wrote, "My Twitter account has been banned in India! This is the real face of democracy under the BJP!! Banning Sikh social media accounts won't stop us raising our voices!"

321.title: Bairstow looks like a shadow of the player who scored vs NZ: Swann
321.article_body: Talking about England batter Jonny Bairstow, who remained unbeaten at 12(47) at the end of Day 2 against India, ex-England cricketer Graeme Swann said the 32-year-old is looking like a "shadow of the player who was smashing it against New Zealand last week". Swann added, "Bairstow wasn't facing bowling of this standard." England ended Day 2 at 84/5.

322.title: Meta to shut down cryptocurrency wallet pilot Novi on September 1
322.article_body: Meta is shutting down the pilot service of its cryptocurrency digital wallet Novi on September 1. On Novi's website, Meta asked users to withdraw their balance "as soon as possible" and that users won't be able to access their transaction history or other data after the pilot ends. Novi pilot was launched in October 2021 for users in the US.

323.title: Remember Akram being angry on Razzaq: Kaif recalls Ind-Pak 2003 WC match
323.article_body: Former India batter Mohammad Kaif recalled an incident from the India-Pakistan match at the 2003 World Cup. "If [Abdul] Razzaq had taken [Sachin] Tendulkar's catch at mid-off, the match could have been very tight," Kaif said. "I remember Wasim Akram being angry at him...[as] Razzaq was literally standing next to the bowler instead of proper mid-off," Kaif added.

324.title: Centre to develop urban forests in 6 Jharkhand cities
324.article_body: Six cities of Jharkhand have been chosen for the Centre's 'Nagar Van' or urban forest scheme. The six cities are namely Ranchi, Bokaro, Dhanbad, Hazaribag, Jamshedpur and Giridih. A total of 75 cities have been chosen across India for the scheme, which will be launched on July 9 with 75 saplings being planted in each urban forest, an official said.

325.title: Assamese actor Kishor Das passes away aged 30 after battling cancer for over a year
325.article_body: Popular Assamese actor Kishor Das passed away aged 30 in Chennai after battling cancer for over a year. Kishor, who hailed from Mirza, was also suffering from COVID-19 complications at the time of his death. As per a report, his last rites were performed in Chennai as his mortal remains couldn't be brought to hometown due to coronavirus pandemic protocols.

326.title: Thousands asked to evacuate as Australia's Sydney braces for floods
326.article_body: Thousands of people were ordered to evacuate in Australia's Sydney as torrential rainfall and winds battered the region. The authorities have warned of heavy rainfall that could lead to flash floods and landslides along the east coast region. "We are now facing dangers on multiple fronts - flash flooding, riverine flooding and coastal erosion," said an official.

327.title: TV anchor falsely claims Rahul Gandhi called Udaipur killers 'children'; FIR filed
327.article_body: An FIR has been filed against TV news anchor Rohit Ranjan, BJP MP Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore and others for allegedly misrepresenting Rahul Gandhi's remarks on the vandalisation of his office in Kerala as his statement on Udaipur killing. Rahul called the SFI activists who vandalised his office "children", but his comments were aired as remarks on Udaipur murder accused.

328.title: He was good friends with accused, knew him since 2006: Brother of killed Amravati chemist
328.article_body: Mahesh Kolhe, the brother of Amravati chemist Umesh Kolhe who was killed over his post supporting ex-BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma, said that his brother was good friends with Yusuf Khan (arrested accused), a practicing veterinarian. Mahesh Kolhe added, "We knew him since 2006." Seven accused, including alleged mastermind Shaikh Irfan Shaikh Rahim, have been arrested in the case so far.

329.title: Guv says blasts killed 3 in Russian city; lawmaker blames Ukraine
329.article_body: At least three people were killed and 50 buildings were damaged due to blasts in Russian city of Belgorod, which is located near Ukraine border, the regional Governor said on Sunday. Russian lawmaker Andrey Klishas claimed that the blasts were a "direct act of aggression on the part of Ukraine". Klishas also called for a "severe" response to the incident.

330.title: 18-yr-old Odisha student dies by suicide in college hostel, alleges ragging
330.article_body: An 18-year-old girl pursuing BA (Honours) History in Odisha's college allegedly died by suicide in her hostel room alleging ragging and torture by her seniors. The girl stayed back in her room and locked it from inside when her roommates left to attend classes at around 10 am, hostel's superintendent said. The girl's mother urged the police to find culprits.

331.title: Need development but not at cost of environment: Amit Thackeray on Aarey shed plan
331.article_body: MNS chief Raj Thackeray’s son Amit Thackeray called Eknath Shinde-led government’s move to build the metro car shed in Mumbai's Aarey colony, "shocking". "We definitely need development but not at the cost of environment," Amit said. "If our environment is completely destroyed then there will be no one left for politics or to be ruled upon," he added.

332.title: Delhi govt's finance dept seeks list of officers for early retirement
332.article_body: The Delhi government's finance department has directed all of its departments to provide a list of officers who can be considered for premature retirement. The officers who are nearing retirement age and are found to be ineffective are likely to be included in that list, officials said. The departmental heads have been asked to treat the matter as "most urgent".

333.title: Will distribute 21,000 acres land I freed from mafias to poor: MP CM
333.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said that he has freed 21,000 acres of land from clutches of mafias in the state and  announced that he will distribute these lands among poor. "Some influential people encroach upon acres of land due to their muscle power and rowdyism. They should know that Shivraj Singh Chouhan will not spare them," he added.

334.title: Hand grenade thrown at religious school in Afghanistan; 8 injured
334.article_body: At least eight people were injured after a hand grenade was thrown at a religious school in Afghanistan's Nangarhar province on Saturday, Xinhua reported citing local media. This came as a meeting of religious scholars and elders in Kabul was set to conclude the same day. All the injured people were taken to a hospital, a police spokesperson said.

335.title: Test cricket seems very easy for Jasprit Bumrah: Ajit Agarkar
335.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Ajit Agarkar has praised India's stand-in captain Jasprit Bumrah for his performance in the ongoing Test against England. "Bowl well, get wickets, get runs, become captain, and put India in a terrific position...Test cricket seems very easy [for Bumrah]," stated Agarkar. Bumrah scored 31*(16) in the first innings and has picked three wickets so far in the match.

336.title: BJP will win in Telangana Assembly polls next year: Keshav Maurya
336.article_body: On his visit to Hyderabad, Uttar Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister and BJP leader Keshav Prasad Maurya said that BJP will win the next year's Telangana Assembly elections. "Today I took [the] blessing of Mata Bhagyalaxmi here (Hyderabad) at Charminar. I request Telangana people to visit devotional places in Uttar Pradesh. We will come to power," Maurya said.

337.title: Actress Mahhi Vij's cook arrested for threatening to kill her and her family with 'khanjar'
337.article_body: Actress Mahhi Vij's cook has been arrested for allegedly threatening to kill her and her family with 'khanjar' (dagger). As per the police, the cook had issued death threats following a salary dispute. Mahhi had also stated that the cook had hurled abuses at her family and also added that he was stealing from them.

338.title: Ola Electric sees 32 high-level exits in 2 years as Head of Charging Network resigns
338.article_body: The Senior Director and Business Head of Charging Network at Ola Electric Mobility has resigned from the company after joining in March 2021. Yashwant Kumar's exit comes days after the resignation of Ranjit Kondeshan who was the HR Director at Ola Electric. According to ET Auto, this is the 32nd high-level exit from the company in the last two years.

339.title: Grateful to Thor team's imagination to cast 5'3" actress in 6-ft role: Natalie
339.article_body: Natalie Portman, who'll be seen as The Mighty Thor in 'Thor: Love and Thunder', said that she's grateful to everyone's imagination to cast a five-three actress in a six-foot role. "That takes a real leap of possibility in your mind and probably not something I'll, you know, get...opportunity to do, to be imagined as, by any other group," she added.

340.title: I have to say I was wrong: Nadal on calling opponent to net in middle of match
340.article_body: World number four Rafael Nadal has apologised for calling Lorenzo Sonego to the net in the middle of their third-round match at Wimbledon. Nadal reportedly had an exchange over Sonego's 'loud grunts' during points. "I have to say I was wrong. I shouldn't (have) called him to the net," stated Nadal, who won with a scoreline of 6-1, 6-2, 6-4.

341.title: Preity shares pic with Hrithik, Sussanne, Sonali; says 'A night to remember'
341.article_body: Actress Preity Zinta took to Instagram to share a picture showing her posing with Hrithik Roshan, Sussanne Khan, Arslan Goni, Sonali Bendre and Gene Goodenough. "A night to remember #memories," she captioned the picture. Reacting to Preity's post, a fan wrote, "90s kids would love it." Preity and Hrithik worked together in several movies, including 'Mission Kashmir' and 'Lakshya'.

342.title: 2 teenagers killed, 1 man wounded in shooting in US' Texas
342.article_body: Two teenage boys were killed and a 20-year-old man was wounded in a shooting that took place at a Houston-area apartment complex in US' Texas, said authorities. While the teenagers were declared dead at a hospital, the injured victim is expected to survive. An official said the confrontation may have started at a pool party.

343.title: I'm really looking forward to Saif's performance in Vikram Vedha: Madhavan
343.article_body: R Madhavan, who played the role of Vikram in Tamil film 'Vikram Vedha', spoke about the film's upcoming remake which stars Hrithik Roshan and Saif Ali Khan. He said that he's looking forward to Saif's performance as Vikram in the film. "I want to know whether he'll beat me, and make it more convincing because I've...feeling he will," Madhavan said.

344.title: Our best line of defence is attack; Eng batters are aggressive: Anderson
344.article_body: After England's score being at 84/5 at stumps on Day two of the fifth Test, pacer James Anderson feels that the team's "best line of defence" on Sunday will be to attack. "The way we've got out of sticky situations is trying to put pressure back on the opposition...Our batters are naturally aggressive...We've been in this position before," Anderson said.

345.title: Udaipur district administration relaxes curfew from 8 am to 6 pm today
345.article_body: Udaipur's district administration has decided to relax the curfew for 10 hours today, District Magistrate Tara Chand Meena said. The curfew will be relaxed from 8 am to 6 pm, the District Magistrate added. The curfew had been imposed on June 28 in the district after the beheading of a tailor for supporting suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma.

346.title: Will miss Aarey protest, have to attend Assembly session: Aaditya
346.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray on Sunday said he would miss the protest for Aarey forest as he has to attend the State Assembly session. He urged the newly-formed CM Eknath Shinde-led government to reconsider its decision to build the metro car shed in Mumbai's Aarey colony. "Don't cast the hate for us on to our beloved Mumbai," he tweeted.

347.title: BJP's Rahul Narwekar to be the new Maharashtra Assembly Speaker
347.article_body: First-time Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) MLA Rahul Narwekar will be the new Maharashtra Assembly Speaker. He won 164 votes, while 144 is the halfway mark. An advocate by profession, Narwekar, who had been associated with the Shiv Sena as well as the NCP in the past, joined the BJP in the run-up to the October 2019 Maharashtra Assembly elections.

348.title: 2 armed LeT terrorists caught by villagers in J&K; ₹7 lakh reward announced for them
348.article_body: Two armed Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) terrorists, Faizal Ahmed Dar and Talib Hussain, were overpowered and handed over to the police by villagers in Jammu and Kashmir's Reasi district on Sunday. Two AK assault rifles, seven grenades and a pistol were recovered from them, officials said. A reward of ₹7 lakh was announced for the villagers by the Lieutenant Governor and DGP.
