349.title: Non-inclusive approach an invitation to disaster: CJI NV Ramana
349.article_body: CJI NV Ramana on Saturday said that in the 21st century, we cannot allow petty, narrow and divisive issues to dictate human and societal relationships. "We have to rise above all the divisive issues to remain focused on human development. A non-inclusive approach is an invitation to disaster," CJI added.

350.title: Heavy rainfall warning issued for several states until July 7, list released
350.article_body: IMD has issued heavy rainfall warning for several states/UTs amid monsoon until July 7. Heavy rainfall is very likely over Gujarat, Goa, Karnataka and Kerala. It's likely over Maharashtra from July 4 to 7, and over Tamil Nadu and Puducherry from July 5 to 7. Heavy rainfall is also very likely over Madhya Pradesh and Chhattisgarh in next few days.

351.title: Totally false: Cong on report of Rahul seeking AIADMK's support for Prez election
351.article_body: Congress refuted a report which claimed that Rahul Gandhi called up AIADMK's Edappadi K Palaniswami to seek support for Opposition's presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha. "This is wholly bogus and totally false. No such phone call was made. The DMK-Congress alliance is firm and steadfast enough to withstand such crude and mischievous efforts to sow confusion and weaken it," Congress said.

352.title: Biden asks oil firms to lower prices amid 'war & global peril', Bezos responds
352.article_body: The world's second-richest person Jeff Bezos responded to a tweet by US President Joe Biden, who asked oil companies to lower their prices amid "war and global peril". Bezos wrote, "Ouch. Inflation is far too important a problem for the White House to keep making statements like this. It's either straight ahead misdirection or a...misunderstanding of basic market dynamics."

353.title: Scrapping Article 377 hasn't helped LGBTQ in smaller cities: Sarathi Trust
353.article_body: Nagpur-based Sarathi Trust Founder Anand Chandrani said that even after Article 377 has been scrapped, the LGBTQIA+ community still faces discrimination in society predominantly in smaller cities. "When we organise private get-togethers in Nagpur, around 300-400 people come, but when it comes to Pride marches or any public events, you will find only 80-100 people," he added.

354.title: Cong leader says 'Deve Gowda will soon be carried by 4'; apologises
354.article_body: Following criticism, Congress leader KN Rajanna has apologised for his remarks on former PM HD Deve Gowda in which he apparently suggested that the latter's end was near, saying, "I regret if my words have hurt him, his family or well-wishers...I apologise." Earlier, Rajanna said, "Deve Gowda is presently being carried by two people. Soon, four people will carry him."

355.title: RRR finishes 2nd at H'wood Critics Association Awards; beats Top Gun 2, Batman
355.article_body: Ram Charan and Jr NTR starrer 'RRR' finished runner-up in the Best Picture category at the Hollywood Critics Association Midseason Awards, beating movies such as 'The Batman' and 'Top Gun: Maverick'. The award for Best Picture went to Daniel Kwan and Daniel Scheinert's adventure comedy 'Everything Everywhere All At Once'. 'RRR' was directed by SS Rajamouli.

356.title: Don't want to be known as a drunkard who crashes his car: Madhavan
356.article_body: Actor R Madhavan, on being asked how he maintains the image of a complete family man along with doing good work, said, "I don't want to be known as a drunkard who crashes his car." "I am a really shy person," he added. "I've only restricted myself to Amitabh Bachchan's Diwali party and Shah Rukh's (Khan) birthday party," said Madhavan.

357.title: Insulted institution of both CM, PM: Union Minister as T'gana CM skips welcoming PM
357.article_body: After Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao skipped PM Narendra Modi’s welcome ceremony at Hyderabad airport on Saturday, Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said, "Telangana CM has insulted the institution of both CM and PM". "CM KCR can hide but his corrupt politics will not remain hidden," Pradhan added. "Cooperative federalism in letter and spirit is cornerstone of our democracy," he stated.

358.title: Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena faction seals legislative party office
358.article_body: Ahead of the special session in Maharashtra Assembly to elect the Speaker, rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde-led faction sealed the legislative party office in the Vidhan Bhavan. The rebel MLAs have arrived at the Vidhan Sabha after leaving Hotel Trident in Mumbai. BJP MLAs, including Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis, have also arrived.

359.title: Amazon delivery agent saves girl after metal piece pierces her cheek at school in Thane
359.article_body: An Amazon delivery agent helped in saving a child after a part of a metal gate pierced through her cheek while she was playing in her school in Thane. Until help arrived, the agent held onto the metal gate for 30 minutes to ensure it would not injure the girl any further. The incident was shared online by a resident.

360.title: Not sure how I bullied him: Kyrgios after Tsitsipas calls him 'evil bully' after match
360.article_body: World number five Stefanos Tsitsipas called Nick Kyrgios a "bully" after he lost the third-round match 7-6(7-2), 4-6, 3-6, 6-7(7-9) against the Australian in the ongoing Wimbledon 2022. "Kyrgios bullies opponents. He was probably a bully at school. I don't like bullies," Tsitsipas had said after the match. "I'm not sure how I bullied him...I did nothing disrespectful," replied Kyrgios.

361.title: Zee News anchor falsely claims Rahul Gandhi called Udaipur killers 'children'; FIR filed
361.article_body: An FIR has been filed against Zee News anchor Rohit Ranjan, BJP MP Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore and others for allegedly misrepresenting Rahul Gandhi's remarks on the vandalisation of his office in Kerala as his statement on Udaipur killing. Rahul called the SFI activists who vandalised his office "children", but the channel aired his comment as remarks on Udaipur murder accused.

362.title: Rare transparent fish found in Alaska, pic surfaces
362.article_body: Deep-sea scientists have discovered a rare transparent fish during a routine survey in Alaska. Sharing a picture, Sarah Friedman, a fish biologist at National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), tweeted, "Been hoping to see one of these in person for a long time! Blotched snailfish (Crystallichthys cyclospilus)." The blotched snailfish camouflage themselves to be invisible to predators.

363.title: Important to follow right footsteps: Aaditya in 1st Insta post after govt collapse
363.article_body: Former Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray posted for the first time on Instagram after the fall of Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government and shared a picture of him walking behind father Uddhav Thackeray. His post read, "Always important to follow the right footsteps. Indebted to all for your love and blessings that keep coming our way, that is our true strength."

364.title: Fire breaks out in train's engine in Bihar; all passengers safe
364.article_body: A fire broke out in the engine of a DMU train near the Bhelwa railway station in Bihar on Sunday. While the cause of the blaze is yet to be ascertained, all the passengers aboard the train were evacuated and are safe as the fire didn't spread. A video of the fire shows the engine in flames and smoke billowing.

365.title: Bajrang Dal, VHP members summoned over Gurugram protest after FIR
365.article_body: Gurugram Police summoned Bajrang Dal and Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) members a day after booking them for allegedly raising abusive slogans during a protest demanding action over the Udaipur killing. "No arrests have been made so far. The probe is underway," said police. The protesters, in purported videos, were heard shouting, "Desh ke gaddaron ko, goli maaro..."

366.title: RPF seized narcotics worth over ₹7.40 cr last month: Railway Ministry
366.article_body: Railway Protection Force (RPF) seized narcotics worth over ₹7.40 crore and arrested 165 persons who were carrying NDPS under Operation "NARCOS" in June 2022, the Railway Ministry said. "RPF intensified its checks in trains and identified black spots across the country in coordination with NCB and other LEA's to target drug peddlers," the Railway Ministry said in its release.

367.title: Delhi Police busts illicit liquor factory; 1 arrested
367.article_body: Delhi Police busted an illicit liquor factory in New Usmanpur and arrested one person. A police team, while patrolling the area, sensed a foul smell similar to liquor, after which they searched a nearby house. They recovered a plastic drum containing approximately 220 litres of illicit liquor, 50 sealed quarter bottles and plastic containers containing chemicals, among other materials.

368.title: India records 16,103 new COVID-19 cases, 31 deaths in last 24 hours
368.article_body: India has reported 16,103 new COVID-19 cases, 13,929 recoveries and 31 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. India's active caseload currently stands at 1,11,711, while the daily positivity rate has reached 4.27%. The country's COVID-19 death toll has reached 5,25,199.

369.title: Will behead myself if I've done anything wrong: Karnataka HC Judge
369.article_body: Karnataka High Court Judge Justice B Veerappa has said that he is "upset" over advocates making false and baseless charges against judges and urged them to stay away from this. "If I've done anything wrong, I'm ready to stand between Vidhana Soudha and High Court and behead myself," he added. Veerappa was speaking at an Advocates Association Bengaluru (AAB) event.

370.title: Is Zak Crawley comfortable being this 'inconsistent talent': Nasser
370.article_body: Ex-England captain Nasser Hussain has said England opener Zak Crawley needs to think if he's comfortable being "this inconsistent talent" in Test cricket. "It's the repetitive nature of dismissals that [will] eventually, become a concern," added Nasser. Crawley was dismissed for 9(17) in the ongoing Test against India, which was his ninth single-figure score in his last 11 Test innings.

371.title: MP sarpanch raises anti-national slogans after poll win; probe on
371.article_body: The police have launched a probe after a video showing a sarpanch in Madhya Pradesh's Katni village allegedly raising anti-national slogans along with his supporters after winning local elections went viral. In the video, the sarpanch and his supporters were purportedly heard raising 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogans. "We have registered [a] case in the matter," a police official said.

372.title: IAS 2015 topper Tina Dabi's ex-husband Athar Aamir Khan gets engaged, shares pic
372.article_body: IAS 2015 rank 2 and Srinagar Municipal Corporation (SMC) Commissioner Athar Aamir Khan, who got divorced with IAS 2015 topper Tina Dabi last year, got engaged to Mehreen, who is a doctor. Athar took to Instagram to share a picture with Mehreen. In April this year, Tina got married to Dr Pradeep Gawande, a 2013-batch IAS officer.

373.title: Sad to lose my record, suffered for 19 yrs, jokes Peterson on Broad's most expensive over
373.article_body: Ex-South Africa spinner Robin Peterson reacted to England's Stuart Broad bowling the costliest over in Test history. Peterson jokingly wrote, "Sad to lose my record today...Oh well...records are made to be broken I guess." Peterson jokingly added he suffered for 19 years. Peterson jointly held the previous record after he was hit for 28 runs by Brian Lara in 2003.

374.title: Nitish Kumar is NDA and NDA is Nitish Kumar in Bihar: JD(U)'s Upendra Kushwaha
374.article_body: JD(U)’s Upendra Kushwaha said, "Bihar CM Nitish Kumar is NDA and NDA is Nitish Kumar in Bihar". "He's been leading the coalition since it came into being...He will continue to do so as long as NDA exists in Bihar," Kushwaha added. His statement came days after Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said Kumar will complete his current term as Bihar CM.

375.title: Will discuss it at appropriate platform: Law Minister Rijiju on SC's remarks on Nupur
375.article_body: After the Supreme Court criticised former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma over her remarks against Prophet Muhammad, Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju said he will discuss the issue at an appropriate platform. "Even if I don't like the judgement or I have serious objection to the manner in which the observations are made, I would not like to comment," he said.

376.title: Varun in talks with Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2 director Anees for comedy film: Report
376.article_body: Varun Dhawan is in conversations with 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' director Anees Bazmee for a comedy film, according to a report. "If all goes as planned, the comic caper will go on floors by next year-end," Pinkvilla quoted a source as saying. Varun, who was most recently seen in 'JugJugg Jeeyo', will next be seen in the horror-comedy film 'Bhediya'.

377.title: Man sarcastically says he has 'bomb' in his luggage at Cochin airport; arrested
377.article_body: A 63-year-old man and his wife were denied boarding at the Cochin International Airport on Saturday after the man sarcastically remarked that his bag had a "bomb" when asked about the contents of his luggage. As per the police, the man did not like the extensive security checking at the airport. He was arrested and later released on bail.

378.title: 100-year-old British-era passport revived by Pune-based institute
378.article_body: A 100-year-old passport issued by the British government to Bhaskar Gangadhar Kelkar, an MBBS graduate looking to go to London for higher studies, was restored by the Bhandarkar Oriental Research Institute (BORI) in Pune. According to BORI Chairman Bhupal Patwardhan, the life of the passport, which was issued in August 1921, has been enhanced to last 60 more years.

379.title: Four teens arrested for stealing jewellery worth ₹2 lakh from Mumbai temple
379.article_body: Four teenagers were arrested for allegedly stealing ornaments worth ₹2 lakh from the Kalimata Temple at Anand Nagar in Dahisar East, Mumbai. The accused were arrested after a resident reported the theft of a gold necklace and gold bangles from the idol, police said. Notably, two of the accused are 19 years old, while the remaining two are minors.

380.title: Mumbai man gets 1-month jail for holding cousin's hand, proposing marriage
380.article_body: A 43-year-old Mumbai-based man was awarded one month imprisonment by Mulund court for holding his young cousin's hand 13 years ago and asking her to marry him. A man has no right to touch a woman's body without her permission, even if he is her relative, the court stated. The minor had lodged a complaint on February 2, 2009.

381.title: AAP members to send ₹420 cheques to PM in protest against 'Agnipath': Sanjay Singh
381.article_body: AAP members will send cheques and demand drafts (DDs) for ₹420 to PM Narendra Modi in a symbolic protest against the 'Agnipath' scheme, AAP's Sanjay Singh said. He added, PM would be told not to do "char sau bisi (cheating)" with the Indian Army and the party would appeal to government “to not cry for money to protect the country.”

382.title: One of the key accused in 2002 Godhra train coach burning case gets life term
382.article_body: Godhra sessions court has awarded the 2002 Godhra train coach burning accused Rafiq Hussain Bhatuk life imprisonment under the conspiracy to murder charge, special public prosecutor RC Kodekar said. Bhatuk was part of the "core group" of accused persons involved in the conspiracy, police said. Absconding for 19 years, he was arrested by Gujarat Police from Godhra town last year.

383.title: Tesla deliveries drop by 18% in Q2 due to COVID-19 shutdown in China
383.article_body: Due to China's COVID-19-related shutdown and its subsequent disruption of the company's production and supply chain, Tesla delivered 17.9% fewer electric vehicles in the second quarter than the previous quarter. Tesla said while June 2022 was the highest vehicle production month in the company's history, the preceding quarter ended a nearly two-year-long run of record quarterly deliveries.

384.title: Pretty unlucky, there were plenty of top edges: Anderson on Broad's 35-run over
384.article_body: England pacer James Anderson has said Stuart Broad was "pretty unlucky" in conceding 35 runs from his 18th over in first innings of the rescheduled fifth Test against India. "On another day, when the luck was with Stuart, an edge probably would've gone to hand," added Anderson. Bumrah scored 29 runs off the over, while the remaining came off extras.

385.title: Some 'qualitative' changes in him: Pawar on Maha Guv offering sweets to Shinde
385.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar reacted to Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari feeding sweets to CM Eknath Shinde during his swearing-in ceremony and said that he has seen some "qualitative changes" in the governor's treatment of public representatives. Koshyari also did not object to Shinde mentioning names of Balasaheb Thackeray, Anand Dighe while taking oath, which he did earlier, Pawar added.

386.title: Lindsay Lohan reveals she is married to Dubai-based financier Shammas, shares pic
386.article_body: Actress Lindsay Lohan took to Instagram to reveal that she tied the knot with Dubai-based financier Bader Shammas. "I'm the luckiest woman in the world...I am stunned that this is my husband. My life and my everything," she wrote. In November last year, Lohan announced her engagement to Shammas. Lohan's representatives confirmed to 'People' that she has tied the knot.

387.title: PMC collects 593 kg of plastics, files 30 cases in 2 days
387.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) collected 593 kg of plastics in two days since the nationwide ban on single-use plastics came into effect. It also filed 30 cases against the violators. "The fines range from ₹5,000, ₹10,000 to ₹25,000. If violation continues after the third penalty, an FIR will be lodged," said an official.

388.title: Bangalore Development Authority officials booked over ₹100 cr land scam
388.article_body: Bangalore Development Authority (BDA) officials were booked on Saturday for allegedly swapping prime land with another parcel of property resulting in a ₹100 crore loss, the agency's Chairman SR Vishwanath said. He added that the officials had colluded with a person named Nagaraj and called it a "mega scam". He also ordered a BDA task force to probe all documents.

389.title: 28-year-old web series actress arrested for biting & manhandling policewoman in Pune
389.article_body: Pune police have arrested a 28-year-old woman, who has acted in a few web series, for allegedly biting and manhandling a policewoman on duty. Police said the actress, currently residing in Andheri, Mumbai, is an original resident of Karnataka. Parvin Shaikh, attached to the Damini Squad of Pune city police, lodged an FIR at Chandan Nagar police station.

390.title: Bumrah takes 3 wickets after setting world record, England trail by 332 runs after Day 2
390.article_body: India captain Jasprit Bumrah took three wickets as England ended the second day of rescheduled fifth Test at 84/5 in their first innings, trailing India by 332 runs. Earlier in the day, Bumrah broke world record for scoring the most runs in an over in a Test (29), helping India post 416/10. James Anderson picked five wickets for England.

391.title: Union Minister Shekhawat useless, absent-minded in meetings: Raj CM
391.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot called Union Minister Gajendra Shekhawat "useless" and said that he remains "absent-minded" during PM Narendra Modi's meetings. He stated, "We'll ask the PM someday why he keeps such a nikamma (useless) minister who remains absent-minded in your meetings." Gehlot's remark was over an alleged denial by Shekhawat about PM Modi's "promise" regarding a canal project.

392.title: 2 kids killed due to wall collapse amid heavy rain in Rajasthan
392.article_body: Two children were killed in a rain-related incident after a wall collapsed on them in Rajasthan's Chhatargarh. The deceased, who were brothers, have been identified as 10-year-old Rakesh Kumar and 8-year-old Anil Kumar, police said. The duo was sleeping in their house when the incident occurred. Heavy rainfall has been recorded in several parts of Rajasthan since Friday.

393.title: State govt will regularise services of pourakarmikas: K'taka CM
393.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Saturday said the state government will regularise services of pourakarmikas who work on direct payment. This comes after over 15,000 pourakarmikas went on an indefinite strike from Friday in Bengaluru seeking permanent jobs and better pay. "We've agreed to extend social security, medical services and assistance for education of children of pourakarmikas," he said.

394.title: 5 of a family, including 2 minors, found dead in house in Kerala
394.article_body: Police said that five members of a family, including two minor children, were found dead in their house near Kallambalam in Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram on Saturday morning. "Prima facie it is a suspected case of suicide," a police official said. "As per the indications received, the family was worried about some financial issues," the official added.

395.title: Wanted to play against Serena and Venus in singles at Wimbledon: Sania
395.article_body: On being asked who she would've liked to play against but never got the chance at Wimbledon, ex-women's doubles world number one Sania Mirza said Serena and Venus Williams in singles. "I did play them in doubles but never in singles," she added. Sania, who entered mixed doubles second round at Wimbledon 2022, is competing in her last season.

396.title: 'Vikasvad defeating Parivarvad' under PM Modi's leadership: Nadda
396.article_body: Speaking at BJP national executive meet in Hyderabad, party chief JP Nadda lauded Prime Minister Narendra Modi and said, "Vikasvad is defeating Parivarvad" under PM Modi's leadership, an ANI report said. Dynasty politics is being rejected by people due to politics of development, he added. He lauded PM Modi for the electoral victories of the BJP including UP and Manipur.

397.title: 2 electrocuted by broken live wire in West Bengal's Bankura
397.article_body: Two people were electrocuted in West Bengal's Bankura district on Saturday morning, police said. They said that 62-year-old Parbati Ghosh was electrocuted when she came in contact with a live wire that had broken during overnight thunderstorms and rains. When 58-year-old Ananga Ghosh tried to rescue her, he too was electrocuted, police added.

398.title: World no. 1 Swiatek crashes out of Wimbledon as Cornet ends her 37-match winning streak
398.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek was knocked out of Wimbledon in third round by French tennis player Alizé Cornet. With the defeat, Swiatek's 37-match winning streak came to an end. Swiatek lost the match with a scoreline of 4-6, 2-6. In June, Swiatek had defeated Coco Gauff in the French Open 2022 final to bag her second Roland Garros title.

399.title: Hostellers clash at Guwahati's Cotton University, several injured
399.article_body: Many students were injured in a clash between inmates of two hostels of Cotton University in Guwahati on Saturday, officials said. A group of inmates of a boys hostel allegedly threw bricks and bottles at another hostel around 1.45 am, to which a few students retaliated, officials added. A case was filed and the probe has begun, police said.

400.title: Amravati police chief tried to hide chemist's killing by calling it robbery: MP Navneet
400.article_body: MP Navneet Rana has sought action against Amravati Police Commissioner Aarti Singh over the June 21 killing of chemist Umesh Kolhe who had supported Nupur Sharma. Rana alleged that Singh tried to "suppress the case" by passing it off as a robbery. "After 12 days she's giving clarification on the incident...(An) enquiry must be done against [her]," said Rana.
